description:
(gerald ford voice): Do you like football? Do you like sandwiches? Do you like fries? How about fries in your sandwich while you watch football?

That is the promise of Giordano Bros. I've been to primanti bros in Pittsburgh, which I assume is the inspiration for Giordao's and this SF outpost of western pennsylvania is pretty solid. It is not a light meal, but it's damn tasty.
author: Misha T.

description:
Really chill, divey place with solid beer and food. The atmosphere is sports bar-esque with an affinity for Pittsburgh. The clientele reflects that with a peppering of all types mixed in. 

My gf and I come here for an indulgent snack every once in a while because their fried pickles and onion rings are BOMB. 

Nice location for grabbing a brew and a snack before a flick at the Roxie or what have you. Hear they do good sandwiches, too! 

Service can be slow but is friendly. They charge for extra sauces btw () which is a bummer cause the onion rings came with non-vegan sauce sooooo. Either way will be back for them snackssss!
author: Alex K.

description:
Maybe my favorite bar in SF! I'm from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and I am so happy to have this little piece of home out here on the west coast. I go here almost every weekend during football season for the Steelers games. It gets very packed and is a lot of fun as the place is FILLED with west coast Pittsburgh fans. I recommend this place for any playoff sports game really. The Steelers' playoff games are so much fun here. It's loaded with people and tons of TVs for the game. Lots of fun and good drinks w/ a nice selection of beer.

The bartenders are cool & it's an interesting one or two steps above a dive bar but has the feelings of a dive bar. The place is also decked out with Pittsburgh memorabilia. 

The Food! They're somewhat of a loving copycat from Pittsburgh's famous Primanti Bros, as they feature the same frenchfry&coleslaw stuff sandwiches. They're spot on with it too. Man these sandwiches are so good. You can't go here without ordering a sandwich.

I love this place and it's one of my most frequent spots since I've moved here from PA. If you're from Pittsburgh, it's especially an absolute must to check it out!
author: Aaron M.

description:
I hadn't been to Giordano Brothers in about a decade but, was in the Mission for a meeting and was craving one of their sandwiches. 

Let's start by stating that any sando with french fries and vinegar slaw is mouth watering and I could eat it any day of the week. Coupled with the great happy hour prices ($1 off draft and select bottled beers), you've got yourself a winning combo. My friend and I split an order of the wings (which were solid) and shared the pastrami and beef sandwiches. 1/2 for each of us. I was a big fan of the bread, slaw and fries but, the proteins were just ok. Needs a bit more meat imo. :) 

Anyway, solid casual meal and plenty of drink options to pair with the Pittsburgh based sandwiches.
author: Benjamin F.

description: I came here just for the appetizers and drinks.  I didn't get to try any sandwiches but I had the combination pierogies which were potato and cheese. They were on the sour side a bit too sour for me. I've never had pierogies before so I'm not sure if they're supposed to be sour. I also had the Not Your Father's root beer float which was amazing. Not a lot of bars have Not Your Father's root beer or at least the ones I've come across so I was pretty excited when I saw you could order it here as a root beer float. It's pretty delicious.
author: Dianne E.

description: Can sit outside and still view what's on TV, service was exceptional, beer selection is great!  Got a 'not your father's root beer' float  nachos were decent...? Gteat spot to kick back and enjoy a beer
author: Morethankimchi J.

description: Went here to watch a University of South Carolina football game since this place is where the USC Alumni Chapter meets in SF.  I was pleasantly pleased!  The food was exactly what we needed for watching some intense college football and the pitchers of great local SF beer kept us happy as well.  The fries inside the sandwich were crispy and seasoned well.  Overall, this is a cool spot it has a full-bar and plenty of seating.  I have to say I would definitely go back.
author: Chris Raymond H.

description:
Had the rudest waitress here for my group of friends. Edit: After she checked our IDs, one of OUR people asked OUR group "why are we here?" and the waitress butted in and rudely asked "yeah why are you here?"

We were stunned. Even after speaking with the manager he didn't care and even asked how we could leave a review without ordering any food. This is how!

She was probably having a bad day but she needed to check her attitude. We're out!

Edited for context because the manager may be unaware of the rudeness we experienced. Totally unprofessional.
author: Spencer C.

description: Pass by this place often and never really paid attention to it. Who knew...a really great sports bar. Lively patrons, super fun to watch a good game.
author: Linda H.

description:
-For your money: good prices. Heroine IPA was 6$ and was pretty wonderful. Margaritas are 9$. Small wings was 11 for 10
-Ambiance: a typical bar spot with highlights of Pittsburgh paraphernalia. 
-Service: so so. Our waiter was weird and took our menus away when I still was considering ordering something. I told her I may order something else and she told me that "they would be over here if I wanted theM"(at the water serving station). OKAY, despite that awkward encounter she was helpful in putting the game on
-Taste: Okay, mainly come here for the sports bar desire.

This Pittsburgh bar has everything a Pittsburgher wants. From pirogies to kielbasa all in one sandwiches this place is home to steelers, penguins and pirates alike. We were satisfied with the taste of the foodz. Water is self serve which is nice. Parking is super difficult but there is a lot on Albion that is 10$ /day. 

Update: this place really is the place to go to watch Pittsburgh games. Represent! Show up in black and yellow.  Can get VERY packed on big game days.  Show up EARLY!!
author: Rob C.

description:
Hands down best wings I have EVER had. I could go back and only get wings! Even though they are known for their Pittsburg style sandwiches. 

It is seat yourself so it is a little overwhelming getting a table and getting served, even if you were just to be at the bar, but the food made it worth it and we were in no hurry. However I could see many people uncomfortable with the ambiance. If you are uncomfortable with being crowded or packed close, I would definitely wave down a server and let them know you will be sitting outside. Don't be shy! Closed mouths don't get fed. Literally. 

Turkey bacon and egg sandwich, along with capicollo and salami were our choices. Every sandwich comes with coleslaw and fries on the bread by default. They've created something solid out here in the city.
author: Tawni H.

description: Delicious not your dad root beer float and their sandwiches and chicken wings were pretty good too. Nice selection of beers on tap.
author: JC M.

description:
Definitely worth stopping in for the Pittsburgh-style sandwiches.  Equal parts delicious and messy, have returned time-and-again for the steak sandwich as I've convinced myself the cole slaw puts the entire thing squarely in the salad family, thus also making it a healthy option for those looking to check that box.

The space is pretty interesting in itself -- split down the middle, on one side is the bar, and the other a casual open seating area featuring shuffle boards -- all the makings of a great hangout spot.
author: Dan C.

description: Finally went here for the first time today. As someone who has been to Primanti Bros. in Pittsburgh, I have been wanting to try this place. I walked in and I was only the person in there, and within a few minutes, the waitress took my order. I had a Steak Sandwich with a side of Onion Rings. The sandwich came a few minutes later, and I was shocked at the size of the sandwich. Unlike Primanti Bros., where the sandwiches are nice sized,  the sandwiches at Giordano Bros. were smaller, but very tasty indeed. I definitely will go there again.
author: Jeremy K.

description: I went to college in Pittsburg, so I was super excited when I found Giordano Bros made this type of sandwich! I'm a vegetarian so I got the just cheese and added a fried egg (for only .50!). The sandwich was delicious, I just wish the bread was a little longer because it was gone quickly! I will be back!
author: Michaela M.

description: Homemade potato chips are to die for and great craft beer selection -- although I'm way too old for the volume of the music in there.
author: Liz R.

description:
Food:
Turkey sandwich Pittsburgh style, means thick bread and fries on the sandwich for $8.50. It was really good, but the fries could have been cooked a little longer. The vinegar is also a nice touch.  

Drinks: 
Heroin IPA
J LOHR Chardonnay 
Kettle one vodka 

Ambience: a manly bar with all football games showing. All fans welcomed, even a few dogs. Some stay for long, some for short time. There are several venues in the area.  I like how the venue opens up for the outdoor atmosphere.

Staff: 
soooo... I find it interesting that 2 other people had bad service 12/11 based on their reviews.. probably with the same bartenders. I would have also given less stars, but I did have a good time. 
It took us awhile to get a drink.  The bartenders skipped over me a few times, which was kind of jacked up. I also heard one of them say something along the lines 'if hitler drank it, doesn't mean I wouldn't!' Like seriously??? Out of all the people you could use to compare.. hitler? Wth... he annoyed me, but I wasn't going to let him stop my good time.



Parking: we were lucky to grab a spot right across the street. There are side streets, but no parking lots.

Overall Experience: it was fun, good vibes (aside from the bartender)... enjoyed chilling and watching the games.
author: Nicole G.

description: A nice little bar/ restaurant in The City. I've heard of this place because of Pittsburgh fans of the East coast. We were in the neighborhood and wanted to grab lunch. I had about 6 hungry teenage boys and Wifey and I wanted a sandwich shop. This was the perfect place because they offered sandwiches, Wings and fries among other things on the menu. I heard they had an"primantes" style sandwich which had coleslaw and frieson the Sammie  with your choice of meat on it. We had chosen the Turkey sandwich and Chicken Verde soup which was a Chicken tortilla like soup. I particularly liked the soup because it had great flavor and had a little kick. Since it was a bar/ restaurant, I had also ordered a beer on draft. I got an IPA called Heroine which was tasty. Waitress was really friendly and didn't bat an eye when we rolled in with a bunch of teenagers. Not too sure how rowdy the place gets when sports are on Tv, but it looks like a great place to watch the game. They also had a shuffleboard table and lots of seats. Definitely will be back to try more sandwiches.
author: Robert R.

description: We stopped by this bar after dropping our car off at Honda. My husband and I have been here before for games and it's always fun. Our bartender was very nice! He didn't push us to order anything and gave us a recommendation for a nearby ramen spot. While we didn't order a sandwich this time, my husband swears by them. We DID get a few delicious beers and an order of the buffalo wings. After our wings, we had some sauce leftover - and when I asked for some celery, he hooked it up! Definitely going back again.
author: Zinia G.

description:
I had lunch here with my dad because he loves a good sandwich, and this place definitely has good sandwiches. 

He ordered his favorite, the pastrami, and I got the bacon and egg. 

I was so excited when my sandwich arrived that the waiter smiled and thanked me lol! 

I thank you, Giordano Bros, for making delicious sandwiches!

What I really like about their sandwiches, other than the French fries, is the vinegar. It adds a refreshing flavor to it. And it cut the grease from the bacon. 

Overall, great food, atmosphere, and people. I hope to convince my coworkers to have our next happy hour here.
author: Vira P.

description: One bar in SF you can always count on to have Pittsburgh sports on. I've been here once to watch a Steeler game and another time for a Penguins game, both times were packed. So I recommend getting here early before the game to get a good seat. I recommend trying the Hot Capicola sandwich and BBQ Wings. If you're going with a friend split a sandwich and share the wings. I like this place but wish it had more happy hour specials on beer and mixed drinks during game times.
author: Cristina S.

description: Our group came here on a Saturday evening to order drinks. Initially our friend tried to order from the bartender, and he came over to our table and huffed and said that he should have been ordering from the server. Ok, no problem...it wasn't busy in the restaurant, but maybe he was having a bad day. Then the server came over and was very cold to us also, sighing and rolling her eyes and being very short as she demanded to see our IDs (of course I understand the need to check, but she truly was DEMANDING and snapping at all of us). I don't know what our group did wrong - we were all sober and quiet because it was very early in the night. The server didn't tell us if we had did anything wrong and didn't ask us to leave, but I felt like all the staff members were trying to freeze us out by being incredibly rude. It worked - we finished the few drinks we'd managed to order and got out of there fast! Never coming back here again. Staff needs to learn basic customer service.
author: Julie W.

description:
Was extremely surprised and disgusted by the rude behavior by the staff. Half our party wandered in here for a quick drink while the other half stayed outside to finish the ice cream from next door. Once seated outside was immediately told to leave and that "these seats are not a park bench".

We had just come from dinner at Picaro up the street which was a fantastic experience. There are so many great places in the Mission, this is definitely not one of them.
author: Shawn H.

description:
Great place to eat if you're not wanting to wait in line. They have great sandwiches. The hot capiocola and kielbasa were really good. The wings are awesome! They're not drowned in sauce, the have the right amount of tang and spice. It's a must have! Also don't fear the fried pickles because they're crunchy and sour but make for a delicious side. 

Great selection of draft beers too!
author: Paolo M.

description: Nice casual sports bar with excellent food. I ordered one of their signature sandwiches, the Hot Capicola, which was excellent. I normally don't love slaw but it worked well on the sandwich, and the fries ON the sandwich were a great textural addition.
author: Michael S.

description: This was my favorite place until today. We walked in took a seat at the bar the bartender was helping one person out and we waited no problem. She walked past us a couple times then another couple came in sat next to us and she brought them a menu and ask what they were having. We sat for a few seconds I was thinking did she just do this, Yes she did. Not cool at all very rude. Now the lady with the red hair sorry forgot her name & the guy both very cool people. I guess me and my friend was the wrong color for her today.
author: Diane B.

description: These sandwiches are nothing short of amazing. I'm normally not a big fan of slaw, in general, but they use a vinaigrette version instead of mayo.  Add the fries, and the sandwiches are really tasty and very filling.  You definitely need to try them if you haven't.
author: Sean C.

description: Granted this place has it's own little niche, so it's in a league of its own. However, once you try their capicola sandwich ...*KEY - with the egg*... you'll give them a 5/5 stars too! It's so good - loaded with slaw, french fries, spicy capicola and a drizzly egg. So grab some drinks, watch some games, play some shuffleboard, and have yourself a mind-blowing sandwich!!
author: Michelle H.

description: This place is awesome. Pittsburg style sandwiches that have crunchy fries and a nice tangy coleslaw on top. Wide tap selection and best of all they have MLB extra innings. I've yet to find a sports bar that actually has any MLB game on but this bar/restaurant does. Place a wager, watch the game sip on a brew, I'll be coming back here very soon.
author: Lance T.

description: Best wing spot in SF! This has been our go to hang out spot in the mission for a very long time and a must see on the tour of the city that I give visitors. Awesome, friendly, and fun service and always a great time playing some shuffle board. They have fresh squeezed grape fruit juice for some real yummy cocktails! The best part, the house made pickle juice for PICKLE BACK SHOTS! So absolutely delicious! Everything about this place is great and I'm not even a Pittsburg fan
author: Taylor G.

description: This place is really great and reminiscent of Pittsburgh! I grew up in Pittsburgh and the Kennywood/Steelers paraphernalia definitely makes me think back. The coleslaw and french fries sandwich is pretty similar to what you would get in at Primanti Bros.
author: Reia C.

description: Came for a taste of home and was not dissatisfied. It's definitely not the same as back home but it hit the spot.
author: Jonathan E.

description: Great casual place, nice crowd. Mostly guys on a Monday night! Great beers, nice bartenders! I'd go here again, lots of stuff to do in the area too.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Awesome sandwich and service, I've been to Primanti Bros in Pittsburgh and this is on par with it.
 
Will be back for the food and great beer selection. 
Need Iron City Beer on tap.
author: John E.

description:
Giordano Bros - the spirit of college football, incarnate.

_Big, greasy sandwiches (filled with coleslaw and french fries, whether you like it or not)
_Great selection of drinks, all day (including bear fights and adult root beer floats ... not that I've known anyone to order them, wink wink)
_College memorabilia, college fans, college spirit, college-style drinking ...
_Plenty of TV's
_Haven't had them myself, but I've heard they have great wings

The perfect place to stumble-in on a weekend morning to root on your favorite team, make a friend, make an enemy, catch some 'hair of the dog,' or start-in on a brand new hangover.
author: Catie F.

description: My wife and I were on a traveling job out here from Pittsburgh and had to get some Burgh food. Right when we walked in it felt yinzer. The bar tender was from just up river from Pittsburgh and still had the grit of a rust belt chap. They had sandwiches that made Primante Bros seem like they were the knock off. Well done Giordano Bros!
author: Bobby T.

description: Look, it's an outstanding place for Wings and Beer, especially so if you are a Pittsburgh fan. Problem is, they have pretty bad TVs and haven't made an upgrade to the place in any way since I first walked in ~5 years ago.  How about a new TV or two?
author: Michael B.

description: Chill place to grab some brews, hang out and watch sports. The place is a bit divided so that there's a bar seating area and another area with tables for groups. There are multiple TVs to watch sports and a shuffleboard table for your entertainment. An easy walk from 16 St. Mission Bart, but it can get crowded pretty quickly so you might want to send a few people earlier to swoop a table.
author: Saachi G.

description:
Lucky enough to have a day to myself and figured I would walk around the mission and stumble into something new.  I'm a huge fan of the divey/sports bar feel, and couldn't ignore the "Giordano Bros." Sign on 16th and Valencia. 

(Sounds like a Pizza Shop at first, don't be fooled)

Took a look inside and immediately was drawn by the sound of 'Kashmir' by Led Zeppin.  Found a comfortable spot at the bar and was greeted by Luke, the 6"4 bartender who says "Make yourself comfortable, it's just me here today so make yourself at home and let me know where you land." --Great guy--

I love it already.  Couldn't have picked a better spot.  I haven't even looked at the menu at this point, but am already sold.

After quick glance, I notice "Pittsburgh Style" sandwiches.  Never been to Pittsburgh or had a sandwich with that description, but when you combine..

Thick Italian Bread
Provalone
Choice of Meat
Oil/Pepper lettuce
Fried egg
...and fries (thats right, fries on the sandwich is part of 'Pittsburg Style')

...let's just say I have a new found respect for Steeler Country.

Wash it all down with a 'La Mission' Mexican Lager, and you've got yourself a perfect lunch (if you're into that sort of thing).

I know that when my friends from the east coast come to visit San Francisco, this will be a great spot to grab a couple pitchers, and some sando's before hitting up Dolores Park...for example.

Thanks for the service, and good eats!!
author: Matt Q.

description:
Was told that the location in North Beach closed, which is a shame. After living in Pittsburgh for a solid 5 years, I have a soft spot for Giordano Bros and always try to make a visit during my trips to SF. As many of my friends are Bay Area yinzer transplants, it's not too hard to convince them to go.

As a Philly native, in my head, nothing really can beat a good cheesesteak and a lager, but I'm a fan of the Primanti Bros-style sandwiches and Giordano Bros does a good job with their own rendition of these sandwiches. I typically forgo the classic cappicola and egg, and get the kielbasa sandwich. All the sandwiches come with fries on top, and don't ask to have them on the side or make any modifications, because they won't do it. Their wings are also very good here, and they drench them in their proprietary hot sauce and butter concoction. My other favorites include the fried pickles and onion rings (duh). Just make sure you get your butt to the gym after eating here, because this menu is not really "low-cal." Heh. 

They have a very extensive draft and bottled beer menu, and the waitstaff is very helpful with recommendations based on your tastes and preferences. The prices overall are pretty decent and you can get a good-sized draft micro-brew for about $6. 

Since most of my friends live in the Mission or near the Mission area, I'll definitely back to catch any football games while I'm in SF, or just to stop in for a beer and a sandwich.
author: Eric J.

description: It's everything good you'd want in a sandwich. I've always wanted a Primanti Bros. sandwich, but traveling there was not in my cards. Then someone told me about Giordano Bros. being the West coast version of the Primanti sandwiches. I made a special trip to the city to find out for myself and I was not disappointed! The place is definitely on my return list!
author: Shannon W.

description:
Really?! 

The girl behind the bar today mindlessly handed me the menu (upside down) and before I could even utter, "How are you?" she took off to talk with her friends. It wasn't even that busy.

Ok - I know it's hot but you can at least greet people properly.

Then I sit and sit and sit some more while other people who came after me get there drinks! 

It's funny how some people whose wage depends on helping people to get food/drinks could give a rat's ass about it.

I come here periodically to enjoy the killer sandwiches and that hasn't changed hence the extra star.

But seriously, I rarely give out low reviews but today this bartender gave some incredibly poor service. 

I'll stick to other spots to get an afternoon drink for a while before I come back here.
author: Art O.

description: Popped in here last night after seeing two open seats at the bar on a very crowded Friday night. Bartender was great with the info for the beer selection, fast with a whiskey pour and even helpful in recommending another restaurant for the food we were in the mood for. The place has an interesting vibe to it, will definitely be back to check it out more.
author: Richie C.

description: Steelers bar!! Their all-in-one pastrami and turkey sandwiches are better than Primanti's in Pittsburgh. This is a perfect place to watch the Steelers game with great energy. Since it is small, arrive early otherwise you will be standing. Overall, good food and great prices!
author: Becca T.

description: This review is exclusively about their pierogies and kielbasa - never had the need to try anything else. I always go for the farmers cheese and potato and get them covered in diced kielbasa and fried onions. So very good, and I dare to say approaching what my Polish relatives make.
author: Kevin S.

description: I normally order to go here and the sandwiches never fail. Hot Coppa is good and you gotta love the unique style of sandwich they offer.
author: Brian A.

description:
First off this is NOT the pizza chain the GPS tools run by various sources say that it is.

The people running this place are not interested in correcting this issue neither. Also parking is a total nightmare if you come here for whatever reason.

I've been to better bars, an the food offered needs more options. Bathrooms are for paying customers only.
author: Madara S.

description: Rude bartender, dirty bathroom, treated like crap the entire time we we're there. Witnessed bartender mock a group of women. I wouldnt recommend this place to my worst enemy. Stay clear from this place unless you feel like being verbally harassed. #nowthisisawkward
author: Mindy S.

description:
So I have an update for this place.  to which I LOVED going to.

I went here to watch the Warrior game with a couple friends of mine, and it was only two people.  One of the waiters said I couldn't reserve seats, which I'm fine with.  However, at the round table in the back there was a dude that was reserving a whole round table for like 5 people.  I thought that was hypocritical that I couldn't hold seats for two people but some dude that was holding a seat for like 4-5 people was ok holding seats? GTFOH. That was some bullshit (pardon my french), plus a lot of rude people showed up.  Some guy even started yelling at someone for a seat.  It was complete anarchy and ridiculous.  Needless to say, as good as the food is, the staff (one of the guys) there (ain't what it used to be) was a bit rude about not saving seats when clearly its only for people who "look" to be the kind of customer they want.  So apparently I'll be watching Warriors/Giants/Bay Area sports games elsewhere.

Probably all the people from North Beach who think they are better than everyone else.
author: Cliff S.

description:
Top sports bar in the mission in my opinion. The bouncer is a really friendly dude since he let me in, I'm 20 so one more year. There are 5 tv's in the dining area and tv's in the bar area. The food options are great too with fries wings among other things. My friends and I chose to order their specialty: Pittsburg sandwiches. I went with the coppa while my other friend went with ham. The fries added great flavor to it, but it was pretty salty. Definitely need a cold one along with it. This was the first sports bar I've been to in the city. 

Really glad I got to watch game 6 of the nba finals here too! The atmosphere is lively and enjoyable. If you're planning on watching a major sports game here, I suggest you arrive an hour before it starts if you want a seat. They also don't take reservations. I'm looking forward to going back with some more friends!
author: Dan G.

description:
If I could give 0 STARS I would! :/ Came here this past Saturday with my girls just to grab a few drinks before ending our Ladies Night in the Mission District, before we even had a chance to enter this establishment/premises the bartender on duty yelled out, "WE JUST CALLED our LAST CALL!" 

Last call my girls & I stated, "How?!" It's ONLY 12:04 AM?!" The bartender continued to give us attitude, and was extremely RUDE! "NO DRINKS, we're DONE!" What a jerk we thought! There was indeed a better way for this bartender to approach the situation in a professional manner! For we we're coming here to spend money?! 

I've been in customer service myself (10+ yrs) this should have been handled differently! Plus, it didn't help that at the time this happened the bar was filled with ALL MEN being served, & they just glazed over at us WOMEN and laughed as they drank their BEERS/well-drinks?! SMH! Seemed like a classic example of SEXISM! 

Ladies take your hard earned money somewhere else, and stay away from any BAR that has the word, "BROS" in it!
author: Divena W.

description:
Casual bar, a good place to watch a game, nice selection of brews, and quality bar food. They offer hearty sandwiches, and I love the mayo-less slaw and fries they add in the sandwich, giving great flavor combination and texture to each bite. They even make their own house pickles and highly recommend trying the fried pickles with cornmeal batter. 

Good place for groups, as they have ample bar and communal seating. They also have patio seating. They are dangerously located next door to Cream, so it's convenient to get dessert after, if you still have room.
author: Nova P.

description: Can't go wrong with  this place! They have miller high life shorties! Mmmm eat a hot coppa Pittsburg sandwich, onion rings, and some mushroom and cabbage pierogis and your life will be complete. ignore the rumors about yuengling, because it's been a while since they've had it.
author: Ashley T.

description:
I stumbled upon Giordano Bro's last night and was blown away by their Strawberry Blonde cocktail. There's a good amount of vodka and fresh crushed (yes, real) strawberries in a cute mason jar. I could literally have like 5 of these. It was definitely made with love! Prices were great too and they take credit cards-which majority of the bars in the Mission do not. Unfortunately, the kitchen was closed for the night by the time we were there. Judging by the reviews here, it looks like their known for their hot coppa sandwich. 

Another reason to make a trip back.
author: Laura T.

description:
Sandwiches are tasty , but something that you would throw together using last night's leftovers. You need to order double meat for a normal portion, which is not cool. Hot Cap with double meat and a fried egg is fairly substantial. White bread that must be a flyover country specialty. Never seen wonder bread used before in SF in a restaurant. Food seems like something we would perceive Midwesterners to eat, but not bad if you order right. I am guessing food will be soggy if taken to go, keep this in mind. Coleslaw will soak through the bread quickly
Losers that work here generally seem unhappy. They are too old to have this job and take it out on customers. Bar menu is great, best thing about the place. Seems to be a hopping sports bar more than a great place to eat. If you are in this hood go to a taqueria instead and then drop by here for a few beers. If you only come here to eat you might be disappointed.
author: Kevin S.

description: These were the greatest wings I have ever had. I was craving Wingstop this morning and was disappointed there isn't one in San Francisco. However, I am now so glad there isn't, because instead I discovered Giordano Bros. I don't even post on Yelp, but I had to because these spicy, meaty, moist, amazing wings are so worth it. HIGHLY recommend
author: Amelia F.

description:
Am in the city visiting my son and needed a great spot to watch the Warriors game. The atmosphere is awesome. Lots of televisions with various games on. The mimosas are great. I had nachos, they were okay, not fabulous. My son had a sandwich, typical Pittsburgh style with Cole slaw and French fries right on the sandwhich. It isn't the original, as I have had in Pitt, but it wasn't far behind. 

This is more of a local spot, with friendly folks. But, you cannot go wrong if you are in the area. Visit it for a game whether it be hockey, basketball, football, soccer, or baseball. 

Service was my only downside. Our server was more into his bros than us. However, there were other servers that picked up his slack.
author: Nancy L.

description: The service was great, food came out quickly and was quite delicious. Outdoor seating and good beer selection.
author: Gaby M.

description: One of my favorite spots in the mission. So many beer choices! And you can get a pitcher of anything they have on tap. Also the prices are completely reasonable. They serve delicious bar food, the buffalo wings are my favorite. Also a great spot to watch a warriors game! They have a shuffle board which is fun and entertaining too.
author: Mollie H.

description:
So I usually don't leave reviews because for me, whether the service is good or bad, the tip I leave is telling enough.  I am not knocking people who do, but i usually tell the cook or chef they are great in person or give a fellow patron a suggestion when I am there, based on what I have had in the past.  

However, the experience I had at Giordano Bros on Sunday night (12/11/16) was way too negative and I want to make the management aware (when I asked for a manager, I was told there wasn't one on duty).

We sat in the far right corner close to the restrooms and patiently waited for service.  We could tell it was busy, so we were understanding when our waitress took some time to give us menus and take our orders.  Anyone who has ever worked in the restaurant industry can understand the struggle when things are short staffed.  We were a group of 4 and we decided to order some sandwiches and finish the Giants and Cowboys game.  Drinking alcohol was not something we were doing because Santacon was the day before and much like other folks who may have participated, we were recovering.  

Enter a second waiter, who ultimately ruins what was suppose to be a pretty laid back evening.  

He initially greets us, which I thought was pretty cool.  I thought they were about to pick up the service after some staff confusion.  I can respect a slow start with a strong finish.  He then comes back a second time, but during this interaction he asks us if we had ordered a beer from the bar, which was a firm "no" because this was our post santacon recovery day as i mentioned earlier.  He continues the interrogation a bit, asking if we were sitting in a nearby booth previously and aggressively asked "what's on your tab right now then?".  We tell him our sandwich orders and he says "ok", so i'm thinking theres some more confusion in the back that he needs to clear up.  We let it go, but we mentioned among ourselves that it was a bit uncalled for.  

When he comes back the third time, something must have made him snap.  He came back to our table with a pissed off look on his face.  Usually waiters who bring out food, verbalize the particular orders that they have in their hands, but he was just standing there with the same angry look on his face.  When we ask him, "what do we have here?", he tells us "I HAVE ONE WITH FUCKING FRIES, AND ONE WITH FUCKING ONION RINGS".  I almost wanted to laugh because it was so outrageous, but we told him who each order belonged to and he then angrily slammed all the orders down on the table.  

So to review the experience.. we didn't get greeted until 20-30 plus minutes of our arrival(this is ok we know its busy), we get interrogated because the male waiter probably thinks we are people who walked out on the bill earlier (people who dine and dash usually don't forget to "dash"), he uses profanity when he comes out with our order (I could have let this go, i'm a big boy i've heard bad words in my lifetime), but slamming the food on the table was too disrespectful.  It was also uncalled for, because we obviously weren't the people he was looking for and we're also ridiculously sober.  This is ironic because if you knew us, that is not usually the case with this roster.

Our original female waitress circles back with us and we tell her what happened and she was very apologetic.  I think what makes it worse is that when she asks the male waiter about what happened, he tries to lie about it and make it seem like he innocently put our orders on the table and we were overreacting for no reason.  I would have respected him if he at least owned up to what he did or kept cussing at us and showed some conviction.  

We end up not touching the food and walking out, which I regret hardcore because the sandwiches looked great!  We also apologize for causing a bit of a scene.  We had one member of our group that was irate after everything that happened (his review should be up by now). We were a relatively quiet group that was talking amongst ourselves the entire time.  Our female waitress can also confirm that we were in the same spot for the entirety of our time in the restaurant.  Even though she kindly offered the food to be on the house, it didn't make sense for us to take it.  

This would be a 1 star review if it weren't for our waitress who was great.  She was doing her best with the resources that she had.  It's sad that in this scenario the waiter who was suppose to back her up, ended up losing her a table (I noticed that a group of 9 or more people next to us also left after the male waiter interrogated them).  She also followed us outside to continue to apologize, even though it was her coworker who should have been doing that.  

There are plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from in the area, and I was disappointed that I received this kind of service at a place that came highly recommended. I can hang out with my 12 year old nephew if I want to deal with childish temper tantrums.
author: Carlo E.

description: Great food, great crowd and great drinks! Joined my fellow Steeler fans for a game and really enjoyed the atmosphere. This place is hoppin! The service was pretty good, they were struggling to keep up with the crowd, but very friendly.
author: Trisha S.

description:
"One Hot Cap with an egg, please, sir!" (Shout out to Rodney H for insisting the egg makes the sandwich!)

That was me last night. And good Lordy, did I have a great time going to town on that gorgeous morsel of heaven-sent meaty goodness. Any of my compadres can tell you I am a lover of sandwiches, and I need to have chips or fries with said sandwich. So the thought of having that combination in one dish was a tad mind-boggling. 

I sipped on my cold Gin and Tonic as I waited in the warm outside seating area, chatting with my dining companion about this 'n that. Suddenly, from the dim depths of Giordano's bounds a young tattooed man, holding two shiny silver trays with sandwiches piled HIGH, only failing to fall apart due to a trusty toothpick, skewered through the center of each half.

I split my sando apart to survey the melty cheese, oozey egg yolk, hot Capicola, fresh, crunchy cole slaw, and crispy French fries. I smooshed my sandwich down and bit in. The Capicola was rich, salty, and decadent. The cole slaw added a refreshing change from the meat. I loved it, fully. My friend had a Pastrami sando without the egg, which was good, but mine was way better, he even said so himself.

Then we played shuffleboard, they have a full length table inside, $3/hour for play time, along with tons of TVs for ample sports viewing, the bartenders are super friendly, there was a guy with a little dog, oh man, it was just the best place ever! Oh, and I won 15-6 in shuffleboard, so there's the cherry on top. Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!
author: Crystal C.

description:
Located in the Mission, this bar is popular for it's Pittsburgh style all-in-one sandwich which includes vinegar-based coleslaw and fries! Parking is street and will be hard to find since it is in the Mission - but if you're planning to drink, I'd suggest taking an Uber anyways - Don't drink and drive! 

Chill bar with a great selection of beer and food for you and your friends. Great place to watch the game because that's what we came here for. ;) 
They're also known for playing their Pittsburgh games on tv!

I ordered one of their sandwiches which is served Pittsburgh style. Two thick slices of Italian bread, your choice of meat (mine was steak - $8.50), melted provolone cheese, fresh cut fries, and oil and vinegary coleslaw, served on wax paper. You can add-on more meat, fried egg, extra cheese, or wing sauce for an additional cost. My group ordered a side of fries which we shared and it was yummy! Water is self-serve. 

I'd definitely come back for one of their sandwiches again. 

Dessert anyone? CREAM is right next door!
author: Mandy G.

description: Best sports bar in mission area. They have a wide array of beers and the place has a good vine
author: Ash M.

description: LOVE THE WINGS! came here on new years day because I was craving their delicious wings and wing sauce! The service was amazing as usual, there were only two waitresses and it was rather busy but they were so attentive! My boyfriend just wanted something warm and the waitress gave him warm water with lemon and honey with a cinnamon stick in it! so fancy and absolutely delicious on the cold rainy day!
author: Rachel N.

description: Got ToGo.. sandwich, awesome. Wings, great. but chips & dip... no dip. Super sad when I got home. But I should've check the bag. They were rocking a rambunctious sharks game crowd.
author: Fuckyelper S.

description:
The place that puts the french fries inside of the sandwich...

It's a Pittsburgh thing.  Giordano Bros is the home away from home for all you Pittsburgh transplants in SF.

The sandwiches are truly gargantuan. The whole idea is that you have your sandwich & french fries literally together, all at once.  

Great idea, right? 
A 2 course meal in 1 course.

It's just positively efficient.  

And the pastrami sandwich is positively delicious.

I've only eaten at the now closed north beach location.  But when I ventured into their mission spot just to take a look, the bartender could not have been nicer.  

It's a huge space!  Is there a game on?  It'll be on here.  

And if you come in hungry, you're definitely not going to leave that way.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: food came out fast, and it was good!!! worth the $8-9. the sandwich comes with A LOT of meat, slaw, cheese, and fries!!!!
author: Sandra S.

description:
I fail to understand why anyone would skip the amazing Mexican places in mission to go eat here. May be those that have had one too many fish tacos?

Anyway, we ordered Hot Capiola and Kielbasa sandwiches. Somehow I must have given a sign that I am allergic to eggs because my Capiola came without one. It was also not hot. Kielbasa was good though. Their beer selection is also impressive.

Next time I am mission, I will likely grab a super burrito. When I have had one too many, I will start eating tacos. Don't think I will go back, not because of the egg thing but because I hate Steelers!
author: Aashish J.

description: Good food! Good service! Good environment for sports!  Beer prices a little high. Great shuffleboard table. They need larger restrooms and seperate male/female bathrooms. 2 girls took forever in the bathroom!
author: Wing Y.

description:
On travel channel they did an episode on Best Sandwich places in United States. One of the places they talked about was this place in Pittsburgh called Primanti Brothers.That sandwich looked amazing and knew it was something I had to try someday.

When I heard Giordano Brother's served Pittsburgh style sandwiches I knew I had to go give it a try. I decided to go with the steak sandwich figuring it would be a solid bet. 

To my dismay, the sandwich was a huge let down. The whole time I asked, WHERE WAS THE BEEF!!! A scant, thin sliver of bland "steak" simply does not cut it people! That aside, the sheer underwhelming portion was equally tragic. Don't be deceived, more than half the bulk of the sandwich is bread. Only silver lining was the slaw, it had a great balance of acidity and flavor. 

If you want fried pickles, Giordano does offer a decent version. The coating sticks well and provides a good contrast in texture to the pickle. I didn't love it, I didn't hate it either. 

Overall Thoughts

Truly the most disappointing sandwich experience to date
author: Eddie W.

description: Excellent place, great staff, delicious food. Don't listen to Madara S. They are a psycho that should get a life.
author: Steve B.

description:
Came here for a quick bite after catching a movie at The Roxie with coworkers. We managed to squeeze in at a table on a semi-busy Thursday night. Service was a bit slow but our waitress was very friendly.

I wasn't too hungry but ordered some fries to go with my Hefeweizen. I liked how they also sprinkled pepper on top of the fries before serving them. The beer battered onion rings were fried to a perfect crispy exterior and paired well with the creamy ranch dipping sauce. My coworkers enjoyed their pastrami sandwich with the fries stuffed inside...will definitely come back and try one next time!

They had a pretty large selection of beer and a smaller variety of cocktails. Stick with the beers! The cocktails were pretty tiny and watered down. I enjoyed my Hefeiweizen and my coworkers liked the IPAs.

This seems like a great place to chill after work or for a sports game--plenty of flat screen TV's around the room. I will come back to take advantage of their Happy Hour prices in the future.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: We came here for Sunday football and it was so packed an hour before the game. But we ended up getting a spot at the bar, the drinks were good and decently priced. The bartenders were super fun and outgoing! But the food was just okay. I didn't really like the small selection. We ordered nachos and the fixings come on the side, kind of weird. The salsa tasted old but was spicy which was nice. The pico was not good. Yikes. Anyways, the guys next to me had the salad which smelled amazing and the pierogies which I wish I got. I would definitely come back but get here early!
author: Gabby M.

description: This place is as good as it gets, other than visiting a spot in Pittsburgh itself. Awesome staff, great beers and the perogies are spot-on.
author: Jared P.

description: We love everything about this place, but the sandwiches really are the best. Meat, cheese, fries, coleslaw, all on a sandwich? You can't go wrong.
author: Nicole H.

description: Having grown up in the Northeast, I had trouble finding quality bar food but GIo's does the job. They're known for their sandwiches served on 2 thick slices of Italian bread with french fries, slaw, and provolone. I got the pastrami and it was a solid option. At first glance, the sandwich looked like it'd fall apart but it did a good job holding together. I also got to sample some hot wings, which you also can't find around here. They're definitely not the same as Buffalo, but it'll do!
author: Kevin L.

description: Good selection of beers, and their sandwiches are so good you crave them.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Giordano's is a cool spot to catch up with friends over some drinks in The Mission. The food is just okay. I have to start off by saying, the first time I came here with friends was right after Bay To Breakers.  We ate, drank, and paid. We were about to leave when the waitress came to our table and said, "may I ask what I did so wrong to get such a terrible tip?!" Needless to say, my friends and I were in disbelief and shock that the waitress would ask such a thing. I am a server myself, so I get the need for a tip, but I would never go up to a table. Ever.  Besides, the tip left wasn't terrible at all.  If anything, it was a respectable one.  

Anyway, skipping forward in time, I came back to Giordano's last weekend. Great relaxed vibes and cool cocktail menu - perfect for a Sunday-Funday. The waitress (different from the last) was very friendly and attentive. Giordano's has redeemed themselves. I'll be coming back.
author: Josh S.

description:
4.5 STARS

I'm a terrible San Franciscan as I know nothing about the 49ers (and football) other than what I see on FB on game day when everyone and their mama think they're a sportscaster. Scratch that, how can I forget about Kaepernick? I think the ESPN photographer forgot to have him turn 45 degrees to the left. *coughFULLFRONTALcough* Hey, a girl can only dream right?

"Yelp Queen, go find us a place to watch the game", my friends said. 

*Shrugs*

Shiet, while I may know my restaurants, I know jack shiet about sports bars. 

Giardano Bros (GB) was listed under "sports bar" on Yelp so that's what I suggested and crossed my fingers that they there was actually a TV. You know one without an antenna wrapped with foil to enhance the reception. I would never hear the end of it since GB sounds more like an old skool type of joint. 

Walking into GB, we were welcomed by a packed house with multiple flat screens everywhere. Just in one part of the dining area we were in, there were 6-7 TVs. There's also another dining area, a bar, and an outdoor patio. Only two bathroom stalls here so expect a long wait for the restroom during game day. 

We came an hour before the 49ers and Green Bay Packers game and snagged the last table. I was pleasantly surprised that the crowd was very diverse and not hipsterville like the rest of this stretch of the Mission. I didn't see one skinny jean in sight. Come to think of it, how can one fit into skinny jeans with the food they serve anyhow?

GB are known for their all-in-one sammies (13 varieties) which are stuffed with fries and coleslaw. They also have other bar food like pierogies, wings, fries, onion rings, and fried pickles. Unlike most parts of the Mission, the food is NOT overpriced. For example, their sammies and shots (Jameson) are $7 each. During Happy Hour, Monday - Friday from 5 pm- 7 pm, beers are $2 off (tons of beer options). 

Instead of order a sammie for myself, my friend and I decided to get one sammie, double the meat, and add an egg to share. The Hot Cappicola ($6.95 + $2 add'l meat + $.50 egg) was our poison: http://bit.ly/1alakc7. I normally like to eat all my food separately but the fries and the coleslaw worked exceptionally well together. The tangy coleslaw helped to balance the richness from the spicy cold cut and egg while adding some crunch. My two gripes were the fries as the didn't taste fresh out-of-the-fryer and the egg didn't have a runny yolk but it was good nonetheless. My friend ended up ordering another sammie for himself so GB definitely serves up man food here. The other two dudes annihilated theirs. 

A must order are their Beer Battered Onion Rings (L - $4.95): http://bit.ly/1albS5E which tasted like Funyuns but so much better of course because there's actually a silky sweet onion wrapped around the crunchy batter. 

I cluck for wings and I would have clucked for more of GB's (10 piece - $7.95) if they weren't so salty: http://bit.ly/1d0wYXf. They otherwise, were pretty meaty and had a good crunch. 

Aside from solid food and good prices, GB offers excellent service. Food orders took about 10-15 minutes despite being slammed. Shout out to our waitress, Pinney. GB was insanely packed and there were only 3 waitstaff for the entire place but she still took the time to check on every single table and make sure everyone was ok. Dude with tats was kinda rude though as he kept picking up my friend's Jameson glass when he still had liquor in it. Nothing that a stank eye couldn't solve. 

On game day, GB's is a total Chad Bro kinda place sans the hipster pretentiousness and Marina doucheness. Too bad, I got a decade on 'em Chad Bros...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Normally love the place especially the fried pickles.

Friends went to grab a spot for the Warriors playoff 6/10/16. Informed by waitress that they could not save seats until full party arrived. That makes sense, very reasonable, no big deal.

Meanwhile another girl arrives, gets one table and holds one with her purse. Another guy gets there, holds one table by himself and another with his motorcycle helmet.

Approach the waitress and ask why these other people can reserve seats while our party needs to fend for ourselves. Waitress gives excuses instead of equally applying their policy. 

Thanks for sticking up for your regular customers who followed your policies.

Maybe your policy should be, "If you ain't cheatin', you ain't tryin'."
author: eric w.

description: I am addicted to the Hot Capicola (add fried egg) sandwich! Add in some tasty wings and a few beers and you will thank me later.
author: Michael D.

description:
I came to Giordano Bros because I got paranoid when I heard that the North Beach location closed.  Lucky for me, I was meeting a coworker here for the ALCS game.  

I didn't try one of their sandwiches since I was only staying for a couple of innings but I did try one of their crazy fru-fru cocktails.  From what I remember, it was one of those vodka, blue curacao things that looked like I was drinking it on a cruise liner in the Caribbean.  

Otherwise, this place had plenty of TV's, lots of beer to choose from, and when I eventually do get a sandwich and some wings, hopefully they will taste as good as I've heard.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Whenever I have a mad craving for an All-In-One Italian sandwich, I always know I can count on Giordano Bros.  I've been to their original location on Columbus a few times and this location is a lot more spacious which I like.

I stopped over to have my usual Capicola with Fried Egg and it was just as good as ever. http://bit.ly/17aU1Kf

I'm really glad that Giordano Bros now has two locations.  It definitely makes it more convenient if I'm craving their sandwiches and happen to be walking around The Mission.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Saturday, 6:30 PM.

Quickie:
+ Food quality
+ Service
* Hygiene

And then...?
Giordano Bros makes simple, dangerous sandwiches. 

**********
Stuffed my face in:
1. Pastrami with two eggs and cheese
     + Eggs tempers the salt, hugged by warm cheddar

Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
*Try different breads
author: Chuck N.

description:
I was digging this chill spot in the Mission!

Having a good group, ordering up rounds of  different types of beer and diving in on good bar food, such as chicken wings and fries, while watching multiple sports' channel TV, was a fabulous bar experience, indeed!

I'll be here surely for another round!  Count me in!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Walking past the place looked interested, inviting. We were looking for something new so thought what the heck. Sat down and immediately fell in love with the friendly people and mega beer selection. Beer was cold, sandwiches were incredible and pickles were stupid good. (Dammit, forgot to grab some to go!)  We will definitely be going back!
author: Diane D.

description: As a native Pittsburgher, of course I had to come here. Love the vibes, the decor, and the menu, of course. We ordered the cappicola and potato and farmers cheese pierogies. It was solid. Pierogies were especially good. However, did it stack up to Primanti Brothers in terms of the sandwich's flavors? Close, but no cigar! Meat, bread, and cheese were all good. However, they need to go check up on that slaw. It was missing the vinegary tang that is near and dear to my heart. They went too heavy on the olive oil, too light on the vinegar. I'd still get one if I'm craving a taste of home, but I'll have a few cocktails first to help me forget the MIA vinegar-based slaw flavor.
author: Natahley B.

description:
We got a table outside at 5pm on Saturday, enough to comfortable seat 4 or 5 of us, but we had even more coming.

Luckily about 30-45 minutes late, large group left inside and we got 3 tables together against the wall. We were there for the food, none of us were really sports fans, so the TVs were actually quite distracting.

But yeah.. that food!

* Hot Capicola w/ fried egg - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/giordano-bros-san-francisco-2?select=87AMcYQYyl2BmxKUGH5SbA#87AMcYQYyl2BmxKUGH5SbA
The fries were very soft - I wish they were more crispy, as they tend to just blend into the sandwich (if I'm doing something as awesome as eating fries in my sandwich, I want to be uber aware of it all the time). The bread was soft yet held the million ingredients really well. The cole slaw was really fresh, the meat dense and tasty. I did try a bite of the pastrami and it was much more crispy/savory than this (I almost thought it was bacon!) and really enjoyed it too.

* Cheese Pierogi - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/giordano-bros-san-francisco-2?select=87AMcYQYyl2BmxKUGH5SbA#i32AQCNfruqYqsoNNznheQ
Soft skin, dense heavy filling, also great!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Great spot to fill a monster appetite w/ monster sandos.

The rundown:
* If you're into SPORTS, congratulations! (you've found the right place) Plethora of TVs covering every game imaginable.
* These are in fact PITTSBURGH-STYLE SANDWICHES w/ fries & coleslaw in the middle. they aren't just AUTHENTIC, they are delicious. I dove into a hot capicola sandwich w/ a fried egg (for instantaneous coronary clogging power!) With everything going on... the bread, the melted cheese, the fries, the meat, the coleslaw... somehow it achieves sandwich harmony and you learn to never question it again.
* Thankfully, this place is CLOSE TO BART (16th St.), which is a huge plus. Decent sized bar in one room, communal seating + plenty of tables for small groups in the other room.

If you're in the area w/ a massive appetite for lunch, swing by Giordano Bros for one of their gargantuan sandwiches, wash it down with a pint, and enjoy some good conversation over some televised sports.
author: Phillip K.

description: So good! Highly recommend trying this place out. Outdoor seating, great beers. Who doesn't love french fries in their sandwiches!
author: Antonella D.

description:
Giordano Bros. is a faithful Pittsburgh style sandwich in the Mission. 

No need to go to the Steel City for fantastic eats.  They make a beautiful pastrami or corned beef with nice fresh and soft sliced bread. Fries are not greasy and the vinegar slaw has perfect sweet and acid balance. 

The quality is just as good as the location in North Beach.  I think I like this one better because its bigger and has more counter space and more space in general. 

Come over for a great selection of beers and one satisfying sandwich.
author: Peter H.

description:
I had heard about this place about a year ago and have never had the chance to try it out until today. We drove from the east bay and were able to find a parking spot 2 blocks away. Lucky.

Once you make your way to the establishment there is an open door with a sign that says "Come on in". Once you go inside, it's a seat yourself type place. Take the menus off the wall and sit down wherever you want. If you're a football fan, Sundays are a good day to go, they have NFL Sunday Ticket. Each TV is labeled with which game will be shown. That was nice when choosing our seat.

When you have a menu in hand, there are several waitresses available to take your order. (This is a good system they have here, very fast drink/meal ordering)

We figured out the system and in less than 2 minutes a waitress showed up to the table we had selected and we gave our drink order: Beer selection is very solid. Something like 15 solid brews on tap and about 20 bottled beer selections. They have house made cocktails as well, that looked pretty intriguing.

The menu is really simple: pick what type of meat you want on your Pittsburgh style sandwich.

The food:

I picked the pastrami sandwich. The meat and cheese were fantastic. The fries were really good. The coleslaw was alright, a little too much vinegar, but nothing major.

Primanti Bros in Pittsburgh, PA is better, just because of the cole slaw. Anyone on the west coast craving that Pittsburgh style sandwich will not be dissatisfied.
author: Eric B.

description:
After having a couple drinks at some nearby bars, my friend and I started getting hungry. We've always seen this spot and walked right by, but after browsing at their menu and checking their yelp reviews we decided we'd give it a try. 

We ordered:
Pastrami Sandwich: Tasty and loved their slaw and french fries that were in the sandwich. Wish the bread was toasted.
Onion Rings: Yum.
Fried Pickles: DELICIOUSLY PERFECT (and I hate pickles)
Potato and Cheese Pierogies: Looked interesting, but they were lacking flavor. 

Overall, food was fantastic. And prices were just as great. I'd come back to try more sandwiches and to order more fried pickles!
author: Dara S.

description:
Who has time to eat a sandwich and fries separately? The answer is... no one! Nobody got time for that! 

Here's a clever concept that actually has a delicious execution. I mean, fries and sandwiches have been plate neighbors for decades, who would have thought combining the two would make for such a tasty duo!? (Kinda disappointed that I didn't think of the idea first, actually) Haha, oh well. 

I had the turkey sandwich and it wasn't what I expected whatsoever. I'm so used to eating turkey sandwiches that are super dry and flavorless. However, this turkey sandwich was moist and zesty. Definitely recommend it, portion size is big, I was only able to eat half. 

I love how there's outdoor seating, I'm not from the city so it's always a pleasure to enjoy my food while staring up at tall, gigantic buildings. It's a luxury that we suburban folk can't get enough of! 

Great location, great food, and good service.
author: Angelina N.

description:
Steak sandos are great
Fried pickles are delish
Put the fried pickles on the sando.
Kinda completes it, in my opinion lol
Onion rings are okay.
Pierogis are great, but expensive. 
Atmosphere is nice. I like the decor. Staff is always nice. We like to pop by when we are in the Mission. 
Stop by Delirium for a proper drink when you're done eating :)
author: Kat R.

description:
I grew up in Pittsburgh, lived in Oakland, PA near a Primanti Bro's and have been to the Primanti Bro's in Oakland, PA and the one in the Strip district numerous times.  

I think the Giordano Bros. sandwich is much better than the original.  Their coppa is simply perfect.  I recall the Primanti Bros version as being larger but the Giordano Bros. version tastes much better.

Now if somebody would only clone the Wooley's Fish Market sandwich my need for hometown favorites would be complete.

This is also my favorite place to watch a Penguin or Steeler game.
author: Michael P.

description:
This place is usually alright. I've been here for many baseball, football and basketball games to spend the time with a beer and game on. This review is solely for the garbage waiter who attempted to wait on us yesterday, if that is even what you would call it (5 ft, 9 inches, blonde bowl haircut, tight shirt and little muscles sticking out his hipster tshirt).

So we sat down last night trying to catch the rest of the Cowboy and Giants game. 25 min go by and no service. No worries we aren't really in a rush anyways and the cold pour yourself water was keeping our thirst quenched. The lady comes by my friends order 2 sandwiches and a side.  Than this guy comes up, belligerent and almost sounding like a drunk skunk, he starts interrogating us with questions about whether we were drinking beers and were the group that left without paying for the beers. First off, we are coming off a hardcore Santacon binger and we weren't really trying to drink, only eat. We did NOT order any alcoholic beverages and were making use of the free water station they had... That being said, it sounds like this fool had a walk out on his tab, and rather than just taking the L was now was interrogating us and every other party in the general vicinity. This is where I lost it... This jackass brings over our food slams it down on the table, and says, "One with fucking fries and one with fucking onion rings." Being in the industry for so long, I knew I had to make an example of this asshole. I called him out pretty hardcore, made a huge scene in the restaurant and basically called him out on his bullshit. It should be known as a restaurant employee that if you ever treat a customer like that at a place where they are trying to spend their money... YOU DON'T DESERVE TO WORK THERE! 

This punk than had the audacity to challenge me saying that he didn't say or do any of what he did, and essentially called me a liar. Than he not only got called out by me at this point, but by every single person at my party for how he acted. Our little charade also prompted a party of 8 who saw the it all before it blew up to leave. Giordano's should be managing its staff better and getting on top of it, because this will lead to less loyal patronage.
author: Tom L.

description: Here is where to go when you are craving a great sandwich and need a break fro Giants everything. Yes, it's a Pittsburgh bar. Right in the middle of the Mission. About a block 1/2 away from the BART 16 th st. station.  I always get the sandwiches. The fries are served in the sandwich and have a great taste. You won't be disappointed. Great selection of beers and wines too.
author: Darren D.

description:
When you talk about dive in's, I generally think of the most ridiculous unexpected restaurants with the most amazing food you'll ever find. This is one of them. If you're a sandwich fanatic, then this is one you will not be disappointed about. This place is actually a bar! It's kind of crazy how they have such an amazing diner inside a bar centric place.

So what makes this place so delicious and makes you want to come back for more? 

Sandwich: Lets talk bread. The sandwiches here use thick cut bread, but it's super soft. You already know that's high-end stuff if you ask me. Then you move into the meat. OMG there are so many choices of delicious meat here and they give you a hefty amount. I recommend the capicola! Although you can't go wrong with any of them. Next. Cold Slaw. It actually doesn't even taste like cold slaw since I normally hate it, but boom this place has done it. It feels so refreshing, but at times I feel as if the cold slaw over powered my sandwich. But what the heck it was delicious anyways. Oh yea did I mention that they put French fries in the sandwich too?! Boom. Game Over. 

We also got some wings and French fries to share here and they were pretty damn good. It wasn't anything amazing like the sandwich, but hey you're coming here for the sandwich right?
author: Nathan L.

description:
This is my favorite spot for a sandy and a drink. My friend took us to the mission location new year's day. We were able to sit at the bar, drink, order food, and watch football. The food was actually really impressive. I had their famous "hot capicola" and it was amazing. It's Pittsburgh style sandwiches with meat, coleslaw, and french fries on a soft sourdough bread.

My friend and I commented how it would be a great spot for a date because it's casual yet the food is still good and it's very clean. Well, it was a winner for a first date, she came away impressed and appreciative. The owner and staff are also really nice. Great location. Haven't tried the north beach one... yet.
author: Marty J.

description:
The door guy was an absolute road block! Showed up to snag two sandwiches to go and he was so unapproachable. I'll admit it was during a steelers playoff game, and it was busy but I was there to put in an order and gtfo. He was very confrontational and rude. He said all these people are spending money and why would he deal with me? I peaked in and everyone was standing with watered down drinks staring at the TV. I'd be in and out with a $25 order!

I love giordano bros and have been visiting them since 2006 when they had the north beach location. Sad they have employees that aren't aligned with management expectations of customer service and making money. 

Maybe next time giordanos. Or get better door help!
author: J S.

description: Giordano Bros. came highly recommended to me and let me say they did not disappoint.  Oh and it's Happy Hour!  How much better can it get?  I had the pastrami sandwich piled high with French fries and Coleslaw.  Super amazing!  Even the fries were super delicious! I'm full and I want more of that flavor combo on my taste buds that are incredibly happy right now.
author: Teri W.

description:
I didn't think this place was very good - it was neither great Italian food, nor great sandwiches. Perhaps it's a great place to come, grab a beer, and eat some heavier food, but it just wasn't my jam.

I got the hot capicola sandwich ($6.75) and added the egg ($0.50) per the recommendation of my fellow Yelpers. The bread was just a step above sliced white bread - not bad, much thicker, but not super. I wanted something a little more substantial, but I suppose this was probably done to not overpower the flavor of the meats. The meat was okay, and the whole sandwich was just on the greasy side. I know this is probably how it is supposed to be, but it just wasn't my kind of sandwich. I prefer something more like Mission Picnic or Ike's with more complex flavors / sauces, than just a lot of meat, egg, and french fries.

My boyfriend, who is Italian, was horrified when I showed him french fries inside the sandwich. 

The service was super slow, and it took us about 10 min to even get the menus, let alone order. I wanted this place to be awesome, but I just wasn't that impressed. I'll be sticking to Ike's from now on.
author: Christina L.

description:
PPOV (Pittsburgh Point Of View)Great food, good atmosphere ...


Except I'm here to watch a Steeler game and they don't have the game on?


And a Cal football game takes preference to  the Pirates game (in the middle of a playoff run) ??


I don't get it.
author: Jesse V.

description: If you're from Pittsburgh, PA you will ESPECIALLY love this place!  Great spot on 16th @Valencia for sandwiches (with the fries INSIDE the sandwich), great pierogis, great atmosphere and owner Adam is really great.  Tell him I sent you.  And they have TONS of TV's for all your sports minded folks out there so you don't have to miss any game!
author: Maryann H.

description:
What? Pittsburgh bar in San Francisco? Crazy talk.

Good beer selection. Decent cocktail menu. Even when it's busy you can still get served fairly quickly at the bar. I am especially fond of the booth in the front window. The only thing I would complain about is how hot it can get inside. Get some fans, people!

Especially like the Moscow Mule! Great for baseball/sports fans.
author: Tara H.

description: Love this place. The pastrami sandwich is great! Its the best place for Steeler Fans to hang out. The bartenders are amazing craftsmen. Good food, the best drinks,  and friendly people each time. Going back soon to eat, drink, and watch a game.
author: Asia A.

description:
It's taken me way too long to write a review, seeing as I've probably put the owners children through college with how much time and money I've spent there. But here we go!

We have to start with the buffalo wings (I know, I know the sandwiches are why most people come here). The buffalo sauce is the best I have found in the city! I am from PIttsburgh, a city that knows how to make wings well, and these rival any buffalo wings I have had there. Amazing, simple, and delicious.

Sandwich-wise, the coppa with egg is the obvious favorite (make sure to get it with a fried egg and ask for the egg runny!). The steak sandwich and the salami sandwich are no slouches either. Fried pickles are also amazing, and the fries/onion rings won't disappoint either. I wouldn't recommend the nachos, but they aren't thattt bad, just not great. Great beer selection, great service, great for all sports (especially PIttsburgh sports), and overall has to be the best sports bar in SF. LONG LIVE THIS FANTASTIC ESTABLISHMENT!
author: Arjun I.

description: Terrible customer service! Stopped here to watch the Warriors game and one of the waitresses asked our DD to order a drink or to get out. This was despite the fact that everyone in our group was already drinking. WTF?!
author: Olatayo A.

description: Love the sandwiches- remind me of Primanti's in Pittsburgh PA. Really good. Service was great too, even though we were seated outside. Love the outdoor seating but there are only 5 or 6 2-seater tables so if you get lucky, great! Don't have experience with the inside but it smelled a bit funky when I went inside. The menu was pretty big for bar food and the nachos were thumbs down all the way. Stick to the sandwiches with the fries and coleslaw on them.
author: Piper W.

description:
I really don't understand the all-in-sandwich. It really isn't particularly good and the utilitarianism of the meal no longer makes sense when you are sitting down to eat. Either way, I have been to both locations and meh. My last visit the servers seemed defeated as they were understaffed, the food was meh with the Roast Beef being bad and the Pastrami being quite decent actually. Beer selection was good but that doesn't really count for anything anymore in San Francisco because every place has a good beer selection. 

Unless you are here to watch sports, especially Pittsburgh sports... you can do better.
author: Ashlan S.

description: The sandos are great and many options to pick from. I wanted two...great happy hour specials and the servers were attentive. Would go back for happy hr and/or sports anytime.
author: Jon A.

description:
If you're going to bar hop in The Mission, start off with a nice, thick sando to lay down a foundation to start soaking up all that beer you're going to drink that night.

We found this location via the Yelp mobile app. I knew this address used to house Ti Couz, so I couldn't wait to try this newbie in the neighborhood.

Really cool interior -- a bar on the left side, seating on the right side with both low and high tables. Totally different interior than its predecessor.

It *is* really LOUD in there, with the TVs blaring various sports programs. However, this place is marketed as a sports bar, so if this is not your style, take your sando to go.

It's worth it.

This Pittsburgh-style sandwich is stacked! Big slabs of soft and flavorful Italian bread hug layers of meat, moist coleslaw, and well seasoned fries.

It kind of reminded me of when I was a kid, and I used to smash my Lays potato chips or Fritos into my sandwiches at lunchtime in school : o )

But better. 

This big boy should be paired with a beer from their large selection. And once I had a large mug of frosty brew, I couldn't finish the second half of my sandwich!

That just meant that I had an end of the night snack to top off our pub crawl ; - )
author: Diana V.

description:
Amazing sandwich's, the steak is a must!  
I've converted people who don't like pickles, to loving them with Giordano's homemade pickles and pickle chips!  (The best you'll ever have!)
Worth the trip to eat here!
author: Jim P.

description:
4.5 stars 

The addition of fries to any dish ups it's appeal by 10-15 points, at least (no idea what rating system I'm using, I just know fries makes food better.) Cases in point: lomo saltado, the California burrito, and the Giordano Bros all-in-one sandwich. 

Loved their vinegar-based cole slaw & french fries in my pastrami (double meat. His request, obviously.) I opted for no cheese, but feel free to indulge. Bread slices are ridiculously thick to hold the tall layers of filling. Pastrami is sliced thin (I prefer a little thicker), lean, & super flavorful. 

He raved about his steak sandwich. Said it was one of the best sandwiches he's had. I suspect the hefty presence of grease had something to do with it. 

Total: $22 not including tip 

Bring your friends to this bar to watch the playoffs, show 'em the all-in-one sandwich you heard about on yelp & you'll be one popular dude (or chick.)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I can't even remember
the last time I purposely
ordered a sandwich with
white bread.

white bread?

come on, seriously?
what is this amateur hour?

I mean what kind of sandwich place
does that?

Giordano does,
and get this,
it hella hella works.

So I decided to go big and
ordered a double pastrami
with an egg.

I was gonna go all in
and also order some fries,
but these genius
super Giordano Bros
already stuff fries in the
sandwich.

innovative.

I decided to wash down
this epicurean delight -
this leaning tower of
deli meat if you will -
with a brew.

Their bombastic selection
of brew
is something
any beer enthusiast
would appreciate and not soon forget.


So,
excellent sandwich,
good brew,
more than enough tv's
to watch the game,
and outside seating for
those nicer days.
author: Dan B.

description:
When watching sports, some key items needed for a good game experience is 

1) good company
2) good food
3) good drinks
4) screens to watch the game
5) drinks on drinks
6) other fans to revel in your team's win..or support you in your team's loss.
7) ideally, a team win, but that's out of our hands

but for 1-6, you can find them all forsure at Giordano! Bring a friend or 5 or 10 and have one of their famous sandwiches, grab a brew, watch the different games, and play some shuffleboard while you're at it. 

For sandwiches, this place is popular for their all in one - your choice of meat, coleslaw, cheese and fries - yes the fries, in the sandwich. why haven't all places taken on this practice already?!

Their sides and appetizers are delicious and unhealthy - just how we want it. Buffalo wings and onion rings are the way to go!

For drinks, they always have daily specials on a particular cocktail, and well as happy hour. awesome selection, and they have a bar section, so if that's all you need, so be it.

And yes, there is shuffleboard to cut the edge off of your team losing and you need to burn some steam by challenging few friends to a friendly, but competitive game of shuffleboard. $3 and hour, cash only, read the by-laws on the wall, and look up the actual directions online if you have no clue how to play, like I have.

Does get packed for football games, so heads up on that!
author: Kristine T.

description:
Pros:
- hot cappicola with egg (extra meat if you want extra happiness)
- the sandwiches have fries in them. FRIES
- wings are solid.
- cool, divey atmosphere
- my NY Italian friend stated, "This. I'm taking my parents here."

Cons:
- I wish the sandwich bread were toasted or something

Bottom line: I love this place (read: went 3 times in the week I discovered Giordano). Make sure you add an egg!

Note: the Mission location has greasier (and better meat) than the North Beach location. (I've been to the Mission one 3 times and the North Beach one only once)
author: Jiann M.

description:
This place is incredible! Great food, drinks and staff. Great fun!

Drinks: they ALWAYS Have an impressive list of beers on tap. Try their "pickle back" a shot of Jameson and pickle juice as a chaser. Tip: one of the bartenders makes the pickles for this place, thus the pickles and pickle juice is amazing!

Food: any sandwich...pick any meat and the sandwich comes with fries and coleslaw inside! I love the bacon and egg sandwich!
-fried pickles are a MUST!!!
-vegetarians can now eat their "chopped salad" yum!
