Fun: shuffleboard and terrific TVs for sports!
Watched the World Cup here and it was amazing!

Tip: there is a bathroom on each side of the place. One on the bar side and one on the restaurant side. 

Wish they were opened til 2am every night.
author: Lora J.

description:
Wow, I have never been treated so rudely by a bar staffer before. There was one particular staffer who was extremely rude to me and then later to a friend of mine for separate things. I was completely sober, so I know it wasn't a case of drunken behavior ;)

For the managers: the guy in question was kind of greasy looking, black hair, with a scruffy beard, mid 30s.
author: Nick J.

description:
This used to be the former location of Ti Couz. That was the place I made famous for gushing down three "girly", but potent Cosmopolitans in record time. It was not one of my most memorable moments at that time. You don't want to hear anymore beyond that night. 

But I do enjoyed the second Giordano's bar much better than the original North Beach location. This one is more of a sport's bar than a North Beach deli/restaurant. It all depends on what you like. 

With twenty-five (25) gourmet domestic and imported micro-brewed beers on tap and my left eye on a college football game and my right eye with an offensive friendly World Series on the huge TV, what is there not to like?

I had the Deuschutes: Green Lake Organic Amber Ale. For $6.00, the Oregon-micro brewed beer has a smooth and crisp taste in a frosty mug. I actually enjoyed this beer very much. I'm due to go to Portland, OR sometime next year and may find this brewery. If not, I know where to get that unique beer close to home. My beer: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/X43AJ7rTKiAS0vuuKRNVjA?select=ZWNkk8BV-IHYkYlAYPVvPg

I also added a small order of Cheese Pierogies to nibble on with my brew. Also for $6.00, I get four hand-made cheese-filled pierogies made like pot-stickers. Despite being a bit oily, I thought the side was okay. Pierogies: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/X43AJ7rTKiAS0vuuKRNVjA?select=tMzKqfbn3ZsHGc7g-avvyQ

Many people were enjoying the restaurant's famous sandwich made with slices of thick Texas-toast bread. I may try that soon and try other beers during Happy hour.
author: Matt G.

description:
Ordered the Coppa and the Salami sandwiches and they were absolutely delicious. Maybe a bit hard to eat, and be careful if you don't want it to crumble down to pieces. The salami was outstanding, perfect with the coleslaw and french fries. The coppa was not my favorite, it's a type of bacon-y prosciutto, but still was super tasty and satisfactory. 

They have beers on tap and on bottles, a variety of drinks and tvs streaming sports game. If it's a Steelers game day I advice either get there super early or just try to avoid it (if you're not interested in watching the game). 

Apart from that, the employees were super nice and helpful. I would recommend this place to anybody. :)
author: Paola S.

description: Great sports bar but having lived in pgh for 15 years there's a difference in the sandwiches. The meat portion is very small and dried out. Still good enough for being so far from pa!
author: Yasin S.

description:
MY PURSE WAS STOLEN:  BEWARE OF HAVING YOUR PURSE OR PHONE SNATCHED.  I was at Giordano Bros. last night for a drink with a group of friends.  Our group took over the whole table, but as things go, people were walking around us.  My purse, which I had put beside me--and at all times our group was seated at the table (we were not getting up from the table and milling around), was stolen during the course of the night and within an hour fraudulent charges were being rung up.  This was targeted and professional.  
I called the bar this morning just to let them know this had happened and was told they have no security cameras, this has happened before and there's nothing they could do to make it a safer place.   I had only called to let them know they should be aware this was a problem and instead was told several times they have no liability.
author: Janice T.

description:
It is sad to see Ti Couz go. I ate there when I was in college right up until they closed and I've yet to find a better crepe place. That being said, I welcome the folks of Giordano Bros. I'd seen, read, and heard about the Pittsburgh style sandwich popularized by  the Primanti Bros. Having just gotten out of a late business meeting at 10ish, and having to catch the BART in 15 minutes, I high tailed it here. Asking how long it would take them to make a sandwich, the server said definitely under 10 min. I was in business. Got the Hot Capicola, with provolone which partnered with the fries, cole slaw and tomato. Now I find it weird to have all those things IN my sandwich but you know what? It worked. The sandwich was awesome and the flavor and textural elements were harmonious.

The space is still the same original Ti Couz layout but painted darker, now with TVs (for the sports fans), some memorabilia here and there, and decent  booze selection to round things out. They also sport some nice late hours so that you can get some solid eats after 10pm. I didn't get to hang around very long, but the server did me right and set me up with an awesome meal to go in no time flat. You're a savior 4.5 stars.
author: Kim N.

description: This is my first time at this location but have been to the other location many times!  Born and raised in Pittsburgh, it's so nice to be able to get a good a meal reminiscent of my favorites from Pittsburgh!  Anytime we have family in town we bring them here!  We haven't been disappointed yet!!
author: Jenell C.

description:
Awesome place to watch a game, grab a cheap and delicious sandwich and beer.

Service is ALWAYS awesome no matter how packed they are. I've been here twice and the guys are always friendly.

I finally got a chance to try one of the sandwiches. Do yourself a favor. Get the Hot Cappicola. Holy shit. That spicy ham is legit. Plus the fries, brightness and texture from the slaw PLUS the fries. AND it's only $8?!?! Table next to us was also raving about the wings

We also came for happy hour and the beers were all $2 off. 

DO IT!
author: Jessica N.

description:
I just moved here about four months ago from Chicago. Chicago is HUGE into sports and you can't really walk down any street without passing at least one sports bar. I was kind of bummed when I moved here and couldn't find very many decent sports bar. Then just walked by Giordano Bros and decided to go in. Best decision ever. This place has amazing food and games are always playing. Everyone is super friendly and it creates a great atmosphere. 
This is my new favorite bar.
author: Sari S.

description: Great place to watch a game, have a beer and eat a great italian sandwhich. Shared the pastrami all in one sandwhich, pierogies and onion rings. The all in one sandwhiches all include their delicious homemade coleslaw and fries!!! So good! The onion rings were awesome as well! They also have homemade pickles that hit the spot!
author: Jackie G.

description: That's one serious sandwich!  I was really hungry after my workout but even then, the all in one salami sandwich was a ton of food. I was surprised by how much I enjoyed the fries and coleslaw on the sandwich. Service and beer selection were good but this is a once in a blue moon place for food.  I'm going to be full for days...
author: Tera K.

description:
STOP WHAT YOU ARE DOING AND GO GET FOOD FROM THESE PEOPLE!!!

Got introduced to this place from a long time buddy and I am going to share with allllllllllllll of you out there about the wonders of this place!!

Our server was super awesome and helped us figure out what to get since I was a rookie and all... ordered some beers and then came the wondrous sandwich from heaven!!

Not gonna sugarcoat it.... best sandwich I have ever had.  Done!  Review over!!
author: Mike H.

description: The sanwich was cold and the fries in it were bland. Tasted like the ready-made sandwiches you can buy at Safeway. Pierogies were tasteless and the large portion was really small. The best thing about my meal was the beer.
author: Julian E.

description:
French fries IN the sandwich? You know the way to my heart.

The hot capicola is their most popular item I guess, however my favorite is the pastrami because I think the capicola is too salty. You can do half half if you want. I would highly recommend adding a fried egg. The sandwiches are pretty incredible for a basic sports bar, because the ingredients are fresh, the meat is high quality, and the bread is so soft, thick cut, and chewy. 

Service is quick and polite. Can't complain. Great place for an al fresco brunch on weekends you want to enjoy the weather.
author: Jess C.

description: Rude server, I didn't immediately order a drink when I sat down and the bartender said "You know this is a business, right?". My husband had been there for two hours buying drinks. I then wanted to order food and drinks, and sat around for 10 minutes while the bartender walked back and forth. None of the workers seem to have peripheral vision. I then got the "nachos", which were actually chips with a thimble sized cup of salsa and cheese. Waited 20 minutes to close my tab. The root beer is what warranted the one star.
author: Monica M.

description:
Man, I love this place. I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could. I almost don't want to share so that it doesn't become as crazy and overcrowded as the NB location. Though it's about 5 times the size, so it's got a totally different feel. It's also got a spacious front patio area and an amazing beer list which differentiates it from the original. 

I'm vegetarian, but I love the Egg or Cheese Sando. My husband stands by his Hot Cappicola choice. They also have pretty decent onion rings and pierogis. We always order the combination pierogis and inevitably they all taste the same, but oh well. The food comes out in 5 minutes flat if they aren't super busy. 

We've made it a Sunday afternoon ritual to go sit outside on the patio with our dog, drink some of the best greyhounds around, and eat some very filling sandwiches. I'll take that any day over waiting hours for brunch. We always seem to get the same amazing server. And I always seem to forget her name. But she's sweet and awesome, offers us water for the dog, and generally remembers our order. Even though they took my favorite beer off the menu, I still love this place. Bring back the Affligem Tripel please!
author: Naomi W.

description: fun place! Best wings I have had since leaving the Pittsburgh area, great beer selection and awesome sandwiches!
author: Craig B.

description:
I loved coming here for the Pittsburgh atmosphere and delicious sandwiches reminding me of home! I planned trips up to SF with others from the burgh to watch the home town teams play while having a cold brew. And yet, during a Pens vs. Caps playoff game the bar decided to switch the audio to the Warriors game instead. 

This is a Pittsburgh bar, and despite me requesting that they switch back to the Pittsburgh game audio, nothing happened. 

This has made Giordano bros no longer my place to watch games, I will instead watch from home. :(
author: Laura P.

description:
I don't know the history of this place and why they serve Pittsburgh style sandwiches, but I've been to Primanti Bros in Pittsburgh and thought that the sandwich here at Giordano's was much much better. How funny that the best example of Pittsburgh-style sandwiches with coleslaw and french fries stuffed inside can be found just blocks away from my apt in the Mission.

Went to get the Hot Capicola with Fried Egg (extra) as soon as they opened at 11 AM Friday. You can get the sandwiches to go, which I did, the sandwich coming out in minutes, then rushed back to my apt to eat it. Though I'm sure it's even better eaten on the spot it didn't seem worse after traveling 20 minutes back home - a sure sign of a good sandwich! The coleslaw and french fries were flavorful and combined nicely. The coleslaw wasn't too wet and the fries weren't dry and bland - you'd be surprised at how regularly restaurants mess up potatoes. And the fried egg just made it perfect. Nom nom. I can't wait to come back to try another sandwich - this time on the premises - with some fried pickles.
author: Jean K.

description:
Hell yes. Shuffle board. Calpico sandwich (spicy Italian ham) with an egg. Pierogies. Pitcher of beer. All set. 

They were also projecting Christmas movies on their screen for the holidays. I caught the tail end of Rudolph and the beginning of the grinch. Woot.
author: Patrick T.

description: Pittsburgh style bar in the middle of the Mission District.  Great beer selection, but the real driver here are the sandwiches.  Anyone from western PA will know exactly what I'm referring to.  Classic rock n roll being played, tons of TVs and tolerant of people from Cleveland (me).  Just make sure to wear your Browns gear and give the owner a hard time! :-)
author: Sean C.

description: Good wings and a good happy hour. Grapefruit sculpin blows but that is my fault for choosing it. Nice service as well!
author: Cy D.

description:
This place is far larger than the North Beach spot, but the NB spot still holds a soft spot in my heart. Loads more tvs out here, and separate bar and dining areas. This place can get busy, and they generally only have one person working each side of this place, so don't expect super fast service. The food comes out really quickly though, which leads me to believe that some of it is pre-made and just re-heated, especially because of their specialty sandwiches that include slaw and fries. I'm sure they have huge batches of their fries waiting to be piled into their sandwiches when things get busy. Huge beer selection here (indicative of where you're at versus NB) with rotating drafts and guest taps. That's definitely an added bonus over their NB location, but you know what you're getting - a huge sandwich (thick white bread) with vinegar, fries, and slaw. It's good for when you're feeling that hangover take you down, but you still want to watch a ballgame.

Be warned - the bar isn't entirely large, and the dining area is communal, but it fills up quickly as well.
author: Danny C.

description:
I hear this is a Pittsburg Steelers bar. But I did not witness it personally. We came here for the World Series game that was after the Steelers game!

There was a short line outside but the bouncer let people in slowly. I only waited about 5 minutes. Quite reasonable in my opinion. 

There's some tables inside on the right side. The bar is on the left side. There's lots of TVs all around. And when I say lots, I mean there's literally a TV at every corner. It's perfect for a sports bar because I'm sure you can usually catch a lot of games here.

There's also a lot of good bar bites and snacks. I didn't get their sandwich this time but it looked delcious so I hope to come back to try it! I did get their buffalo wings and fried pickles though. Yum. 

They have a broad selection of beers. Pitchers are about $18 each. There's a lot of craft beers that ranged from about $5-$7 a glass. I liked the Oaktown Brown that I had. 

Bottom line, great sports bar! Can't wait to come back for games!
author: Connie Y.

description: The loaded-up sandwiches are pretty good -- recommend the steak sandwich.
author: Sara R.

description:
Man I hate to do this. The first time we went here I was in love. I'm a Pirates fan and would have never guessed I'd find a Pittsburgh bar on the west coast. The place was slammed, and our server was the greatest. She was super attentive even though she was basically waiting on the entire restaurant. We left fed and happy. 

Take two. 

Stopped in for lunch. Was met by a super chill bartender who took my order and served me. Everything was going fine until a roach two stepped by my feet. 

I've lived in land of the roach aka New York City for years. But the sight of one still sends me reeling. Especially when I'm eating. 

Bugs exist in the world. This is true. But I just can't deal with them while I'm eating. So I'm sorry to do it to you guys. But no dice.
author: Ryley P.

description:
The sandwiches here are insane. And a nice amount of TVs if you're trying to watch the NLDS like we were last week.

The perogies are also very nice--get the mix. Just don't do what I did and order to full orders so you get too full to finish your sandwich.

Good beers by the glass or pitcher--we had a few Scrimshaws which did the trick.

Service is a bit hit or miss. Great people with great attitude but they disappear a lot. Also, we were hoping to get our app before lunch, but it ended up coming with our main meal.
author: Paul C.

description:
THE WINGGGGGS! 

This place is my favorite neighborhood spot. I love all the bartenders and the food is always bomb. The wings rule and so do the fired pickles!
author: Stix B.

description:
TVs everywhere. Game audio on. Actual fans present.

Plus they show the NHL playoffs.

Bomb Pittsburgh sandwiches. Has fries and slaw on em. Like California burritos down south. Mmmmm. 

Good variety of brews on tap too.
author: Alvin D.

description: Really fun place to get a Pittsburgh sandwich and what the Pittsburgh games! Go Penns! Plus they have fresh squeezed grapefruit juice for a Greyhound.
author: Addie S.

description: Great stop for a quick American lunch. Had the pastrami sandwich, wings and washed it all down with a pitcher of Stella. Even though we went during off hours, the service was excellent. I'll definitely be back!
author: Aaron J.

description:
Bad service. They need to staff their restaurant better! The poor waiter had an entire packed side of the restaurant to himself!
Bad food. Don't order the dessert cookie! sounds interesting, it's dry & awful!
Would Not go back!
Decent beer selection
We only stayed to watch the end of the hockey game.
author: Ashley G.

description:
I have such a hard time resisting this place even though they gave me cold fries one time.  But it only happened once and never happened again. 
Maybe it was a slow night, lazy chef, I don't know but I really love their hot cappicola sandwich WITH the Fried Egg inside. 
I didn't like the sausage sandwich too much but the steak and eggs was delicious. 
I don't know what it is about this bread, the coleslaw and the fries but it all comes together so well. 
I really enjoy coming here for a sandwich while watching a game.
author: Chris L.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for years and after all this time.... IT WAS WORTH IT.  After watching Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives, I really wanted to go to Pittsburg just to try the Primanti Bro's sandwich.  Browsing yelp, Giordano Bros had a similar sandwich and I HAD to try it.  

I got the Hot Capicola and it was delicious. Just the right size, the slaw was peppery, the fries were not overly soft or too crunchy, the bread was everything you can ask for.... huNNGghhhhhh. The Bloody Mary wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. Next time I'll get a beer or a glass of wine. 

It gets overly crowded fast, so get there early. Also, I love their policy of no saving seats/tables! Some of us waited in line for +30mins, bro. GET TO THE BACK OF THE LINE!!!!!
author: Ellie L.

description:
In honor of this place's amazing food and Pittsburgh pride, I present a musical tribute to Giordano Bros., sung to the tune of "Black and Yellow" by Wiz Khalifa:

author: Fakename D.

description: Great bar especially fir the Steeler fan or Pittsburgher.  The food is genuine Permanti Bros-esque. Great selection of beers, ales etc. WILL recommend, WILL go back!!
author: Jay R.

description: Great steak sando! Highly recommend to hungry eaters. Came in on a quiet Thursday - quick , easy and tasty. Good atmosphere and service - will be back for more!!!
author: Paul R.

description: Does it get better? I'll soon find out, this is one of those places where you plan your next visit while indulging in on their scrumptious sandwiches! I got the steak with fried egg to be safe. On the side I had their bomb ass onion rings! They got the onion ring science down to the tee. It's a very loud place especially if football is on.
author: Sarah N.

description:
We stopped by Giordano Brothers to catch the tail end of Game 5 of the NLDS (and because it was on my list of restaurants to check out). It was pretty crowded, but we managed to find a table for the seven of us.

Since we had already eaten dinner, we just ordered some Beer Battered Onion Rings, Buffalo Wings, and Deep Fried Pickles, all of which were really good. But their sandwiches were what brought me there, so even though I was full, I ordered the Hot Capicola with a fried egg. It. Was. Delicious. This was my first time trying Capicola, and I assure you, I will be looking for it from now on. The bread got mushy and fell apart as we ate the sandwich, but everything else about the sandwich was fantastic. I've never been to Pittsburgh (and I don't know if I ever will), so I'll probably never get to try Primanti Brothers, but that's okay... I can always go to Giordano for these great sandwiches.

Great food (esp for a sports bar), great service, and a great place to watch a game.
author: Ken K.

description: This is a great sports bar. Specially during football season I love to come out here and enjoy the atmosphere since everyone is a Steelers fan. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The wings are finger licking good. Pretty much anything on the menu you get is great.
author: Martha R.

description: I came back for the pastrami sandwich lol. It was still awesome :) the chopped salad is good too, a lot of flavour and a large portion (it was big enough for my bf and i to share). I'm upping my review to 5 stars :))))
author: Bianca C.

description: Excellent atmosphere to watch a game!!  No place around comes close.  Staff has always been friendly.  Copa is my favorite and the fried pickles are incredible.  Food is reasonably priced, great beer menu.....what more can you ask for?
author: Jason p.

description:
If I could put a minus before the star I would. The bartender from today was absolutely rude. I'm not a youngster but I love to hang out with friend at local places. Been at the place before and never had an issue but today I felt as if I was a teenager asking for drinks and I wanted to tell this young bartender respect is important at any age. We did not order a drink and just decided to leave and go to the Phoenix where service is better. 
Example of what happen.
Asked the new waiter what is your happy hour menu he said only beer, I ask no wine he said no. Ok so I requested a beer and a nice lady came over and told me they do have wine on their happy hour. So I went to the bar and told the Bartender your waiter did not tell me about the wine, can I change it. At that point the bartender gave me an attitude and did not say sorry for the misunderstanding. My friend arrived and we went to the bar and as we were looking at the menu I notice they had well drinks on the happy hour menu. At this point I have  not had a drink from from my glass of wine and ask the bartender can you put my wine glass aside and I will pay full price for it because I would like a cocktail. The bartender said you can't stock up on happy hour drinks. I explain to him what the waiter told me about your HR menu. Again the bartender repeated himself with the same comment. Ok I'm a grounded person but I held back from being his mother. At this point we just left. Shame on you young man for not acting like a gentleman and a person. We all have stressful jobs and if you don't like what you do change it. Will go back because the rest of the staff is great.
author: Maria H.

description: I will say I am probably a bit biased in my review because I am a huge Steelers fan and love going to this place on game days.  If your from Pittsburgh this place is decorated in Kennywood memorabilia and its great to see some of the reminders of my childhood.  I also love the songs they play before a game and after (if we win).  Get there early on gameday there are a ton of seats but it can get crowded.  Pretty good beer list and a full bar as well.  We order a couple pitchers and then I've had some of their cocktails.  The sandwiches here are AMAZING!!! I love the pastrami the best.  They are pretty close to the original primanti brothers in Pittsburgh too!  The fries are fresh cut and really delicious!
author: Kate F.

description:
Beers = on draft.  Good selection and lots of microbrews.  Prices run from $4-8.  I tried the Green Flash IPA, which was good.  They also had the local Magnolia IPA.

Food = delicious.  For those complaining about lack of meat.  Give me an effin' break, how much meat do you NEED??  I had the spicy sausage sandwich... delicious sausage, topped with french fries, cole slaw and added the fried egg.  I'll be back for more.  

Prices = reasonable.  

It's March Madness so this place was a bit packed on a Friday, but I like the layout of bar and dining, separated.   And they have shuffleboard.
author: Fannie S.

description: Gotta love a place that will show random Serie A soccer matches and put Alabama football on its big-screen than it's hometown, world champion (and undefeated) Warriors.  I didn't know I was in the South.  #rolltide
author: Paul R.

description:
I heard this place was good (by "heard" I always mean read on yelp) so I have been eying it when I'm in the hood. Randomly walked by last weekend and happened to notice a server being totally rude to some customers outside, noted. When we came for dinner we ended up getting the same server but I didn't realize until we were leaving and talking about how bad the service was, I had a sudden aha moment.  There's a hand painted notice on the wall that says seat yourself and it totally blends in to all of the other stuff written all over the walls. We stood there clueless for like 5 mins wondering why were being ignored before we noticed it and followed directions.  After sitting, I noticed every single other group that came in did the same thing and I watched our moody server look at them annoyed and then ignore them. Oh god forbid customers don't read ur dumb sign, maybe if 10/10 stand there clueless- it's not us, it's ur sign. 
I could go on and on about the service but eff it, let's talk food. 
The sandwiches screamed, yearned, NEEDED that damn bread to be toasted!! Come on! It was falling apart and the sloppy slaw inside and pile of other ingredients were busting out! Speaking of slaw, while it is refreshing to see a vinegar dressed slaw, the only flavor this had was sweetness, needed more acid and seasoning. The meat wasn't very tender and just not that tasty but the worst was the fries. I reeeally think they are using Yukon gold potatoes which are a roasting or mashing tater not a fry tater. Too sweet, creamy and moist. They make weird fries. It took us so long to get our check that we stood up and considered just leaving without paying. I won't be back and it's unfortunate because the atmosphere and outdoor seating was nice, I liked the brewery atmosphere, reminded me of home.
author: Emma H.

description:
For Pennsylvanians, it can be difficult finding authentic, quality, accurate recreations of our outstanding, maybe a little eccentric at times but always tasty, cuisine when we travel abroad. This can be distressing, as often we find ourselves staring down at some "steak and cheese sandwich" or whatever, disappointed, out the cash, and still hungry. 

This place has it. Even the pierogies.
author: Todd B.

description: Wings are very good and the service has been great! It's right up the road from us, so we love it as a local place to eat, drink and chill.
author: Will R.

description:
We came here to snack while we waited in the 1.5-3.5 hour long wait for a table at Monk's Kettle..

I tried the Pierogi, Steak Sandwich, and Onion Rings. 
Pierogi was okay, it was a lot more oily than I expected. Decent but not amazing. 
Steak Sandwich was really good! There was a lot of meat, I definitely would not have been able to eat much of that sandwich by myself, so good thing we were sharing. Why don't more places put fries in their sandwiches?
Onion rings were fine. Not bad at all, but just not super special. 

It was also not super crowded, not super loud, and not super dark so that was a plus :)
author: Sophie Y.

description: Great place, great food and good people!  Try the pickles and especially the pickle back!
author: Marc W.

description:
Of the two Giorando locations in the city, this one is my favorite. Larger seating/bar area compared to the one in North Beach plus a tiny outdoor patio to enjoy. I went to school and lived in Pittsburgh for awhile so coming here is a little taste of home. The ingredients of the sandwich, styled after Primanti Brothers in PA, tasted almost exact but the bread was a bit too thick in comparison. I've met some people whom I've shared an association with from living in Pittsburgh so it's always interesting with the stories you walk away with. 

On game days, be prepared to be in a crowded bar but everyone is loving the sports and it's worth it. Go Steelers!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I didn't really care for the sandwiches, so this review is mainly for the grotesque  service.

Four of us dined here for lunch during non-peak hours (after 2pm) and the place was half empty. It seemed that there was only one waitress. Bad sign, should have gotten up a left after we were sitting at the table for 10 minutes without as much as an acknowledgement. 

But just as I was about to suggest that we walk out, the waitress arrived at our table. "Ready to order??" No hello, no smile. 

So we ignored the rudeness and proceed to order since we were all hungry. My friend had a question about one of the sandwiches, and my poor friend had such an attitude answer from the waitress. A big sigh and rolling of the eyes type of answer. At this point we were just fuming. THEN she got two of our orders wrong -- turkey sandwiches came out instead of steak sandwiches. AND my friend was missing the fried egg that was supposed to accompany her sandwich and had to send it back to the kitchen. Not very good for business, if your waitress messes three out of four orders. Three wasted sandwiches. 

And by the way, the sandwiches weren't that great either! I felt like a big fool dinning at this place. I suggest others not be foolish like us.
author: Critic X.

description: This place is killer! We come each Sunday to watch the Steelers play.  It's worth the trip into the city.  Great food and drinks and the service is great.  Such a fun inclusive environment!
author: Ingrid A.

description:
Staff: Friendly and accepted my suggestions for improvement (fresh fries)
Atmosphere: Casual, loud, lots of TV's, great for a quick bite when you're hungry!
The Price: It seems reasonable, and it is compared to all the places in North Beach for cheap eats. But don't think you'll surprisingly get a too good to be true-sized sub here. It's $7.50 and the meat is a thin layer...might as well make it a $9.50 sub by ordering double meat! 
The Meat And Potatoes (AKA The Sandwich): Hot pastrami was delicious, the slaw was delicious, the bread DEFINITELY should be a wider sliced french roll and needs toasting! The soft bread easily falls apart and could barley survive the juices of the slaw...I can't see how it would stand a fried egg. The fries were absolutely stale and in pieces (last of the batch?) When I politely told the waiter, he admitted they were almost at the bottom of the batch! Then he said he'll throw the rest out. And he seemed honest I appreciated that he acknowledged my suggestion.
author: Sarbjit K.

description:
I just happen to notice this place while walking down 16th in search of food to go. I wanted to try something new, so I decided to check out Giodano Bros. 

It looked like a bar, but I noticed people eating sandwiches and was intregied by the all-in-one sandwiches and figured that might be a good one to get the guy. I ordered a smoked turkey and while I was waiting I had an Ommegang Hennepin. 

When I got back we unwrapped this marvalous sandwich made of thick bread, smoked turkey with coleslaw and french fries. Truly the all-in-one sandwich! 

I will definately be back, they have an awesome beer menu and it's almost baseball season. Good sports bars that carry good beer are a good thing in my book. GO GIANTS!!!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
3.5 stars + .5 star for service.

Huge flatscreens, a variety of drafts and bottled beers, a moose head currently decorated with Christmas lights... this has been our improv class' favorite hangout. They're friendly and efficient, even when big games are on, and the fries are crispy, meaty, everything they should be after a long morning of make-em-ups.

Tried most of the sandwiches on the menu and I think the steak is my favorite, followed by the sweet sausage. Pastrami in particular was underwhelming and dry, not even helped by the crispy slaw. The wings are a little small and I've yet to try the pierogies, but they look like greasy goodness.

Plus, they serve Shiner Bock (bottle) and have a Devil's Canyon ale on the menu.
author: Steph C.

description:
Native yinzers know the grip Primanti's has over the collective consciousness of western PA and parts of Florida.  After all, what's not to love about good food, your choice of good or bad beer, and people who manage to remain polite in crowded situations? Sadly, most of us who choose to seek our fortunes elsewhere have to leave this experience behind save for the occasional trip home to see the parents over Christmas.  In the heart of SF, though, we can still gather at Giordano Bros. to come together as Steelers nation and grab dinner with one hand, leaving the other free to toss back a brew or wave a Terrible Towel.

The staff has always been super friendly, every time I come in. Even when the place is crowded it's possible to get food or drinks without too much effort. The bar is stocked with all the beer or whiskey one would need, and your food dollar goes a pretty long way here.  The only anomaly longtime Primanti's patrons will notice is the lack of tomatoes on the sandwich. I am willing to overlook this and give the place top marks.  I intend to keep returning, and that right frequently.
author: Bradley M.

description: These guys are the most chilled out yet professional bunch.  Come for lunch and catch the game, or sit outside and relax with a Pacifico and watch San Francisco happen.  I don't drop names but Corey, David, Anna, Alexa, Tim, and Ryan are why I and many others come here on our days off. OH AND you need to try the Kielbasa with and egg sandwich, it's Devine
author: Ryan M.

description:
My wife and I were in San Francisco for a business conference.  We had some down time, so we decided to go walking around.

We walked by a street sign that read "Soup of the day - Beer".  That's how we ended up walking into Giordano Bros.

Once inside, we sat at the bar.  We were quite impressed with the selection of beers on tap.  We proceeded to have a couple, when I noticed a peculiar sandwich being prepared on the grille.  We asked the friendly bartender what it was.

She proceeded to tell us that they prepare authentic Pittsburgh style sandwiches (Should have known it was something Pittsburgh....The walls of the place were covered with Steelers, Penguins and Pirates stuff).  It is stacked with a bug hunk of meat, coleslaw, and french fries.  We've never heard of such a thing.  We ordered a pastrami sandwich to see what it was all about.

Holy crap, was this an awesome sandwich.  If you've never had one, you gotta.  We will most certainly go back to Giordano Bros when we get back to San Fran.  I'm already jonzin' for one of those sammiches as I type this.

All in all, A+ for a great bar, great staff, and great food.
author: Chris Z.

description: How bad can a sandwich with french fries inside it really be? These sandwiches are awesome. They also have a great selection of beer. This place is crowded and loud, but it's great for meeting up with friends after work for drink or a quick dinner.
author: Diana G.

description:
I popped in today, the 4th of July, for a treat after yoga on the holiday (and really because I was disappointed that I wasn't invited to any Independence Day bbq's - sadness abounds)

There was only one gal working the room for orders (yet she was oddly efficient, probably b/c she only takes the ordered and delivers your check - someone else delivers the food)

I ordered the steak with cheese and added a fried egg.  (the only real complaint was that the egg wasn't runny which I was hoping for)  Otherwise a fine, very fine sandwich. Great slaw, home-cut fries, nice balance of meat and cheese on nice soft  & fresh sliced Italian Bread.  MMMMM, yummers.  My total was $8.03 (not including tip) that is a fair deal I would say, and I have been full for hours now.
author: Amy W.

description:
The fries are the best fries in the history of the universe. 

I had the pastrami sandwich with an egg. It was really good. 

Pro-tips: 
1) if you get a sandwich, add an egg
2) the buffalo sauce is amazing. Get a side and dip your fries / sandwich in it

This place is perfect comfort food. Lots of beers and there is a moose on the wall.
author: John H.

description: Sorry to learn that the North Beach location has closed as that's the one I used to frequent especially for the Steelers playoff games. I've been to both Giordano and Primanti Bros. and can say that they're both quality products. I haven't tried anything but the all-in with pastrami plus the fried egg but can vouch for that sandwich (sammich) being a winner every time. Worth a visit for any Pittsburgh-area ex-pat who miss the stuff they used to get at home.
author: John N.

description:
I went here after a board meeting with other members of the board.  You know how attorneys can drink!

The wings were some of the best I've had.  The other stuff was just okay.  I like that they have multiple kinds of ciders here.  The pear cider was good.

My big complaint is that it was SO NOISY!  Yeah, I know it's a bar, but they actually turned the music UP after our group came in, making it even harder to hear each other.

Boo for that move.
author: Shanthi G.

description: (Double Egg all in one sandwich) Best hangover cure ever. In the Russian hills branch, I had been to an end of work party and was paying for it the next day. A Pacifico and their Double Egg all in one sandwich and everything was alright with the world.
author: Benjamin D.

description:
Giordano Bros (in the mission) is an awesome place to go to eat, drink and watch sports! 

The service here was absolutely phenomenal! Yvonne the bartender was friendy, attentive and gave us the best customer service. We never had an empty glass and she recommended great beers! It can be difficult to get good service at a bar but she was incredible and made our experience at Giordano Bros one for the books! We would definitely come back!!!!

The happy hour deals were good in comparison to the bars nearby. The fries and onion rings were gooood and the wings were decent (a little to much buffalo sauce for my liking). The vibe was chill and it wasnt too crowd...My friends and I were still able to hold a coversation without having to scream in each others ears! 

So if youre a sports fan and love drinking them come on by to Giordano Bros...Im definitely trying a sandwhich next time im there...cuz word on the block is they put french fries in your sandwich :)
author: Nicole Dawn A.

description:
Fries in a sandwich? A little too American if you know what I mean. It was kind of over-the-top. But then again, it's a bar, and that's probably bar food at it's best. Or stoner food. Either or, it's definitely kind of too much to have fries in my sandwich, and fries on the side.

However, I can't do too much complaining because my Capicola (spicy ham) sandwich was pretty damn good. They pack that thing with meat (and fries) and it's a nice go-along with beer.

The bar is really laid back and not too rowdy. I don't know if it's my type of bar or if I'm crazy about their sandwiches, but I don't hate it. There were plenty of tables when we went, but we also went on a Tuesday night, so I'm not sure how busy they get on the weekends.

Our server was nice and I have nothing to complain nor rave about. Just an a-ok bar with interesting sandwiches.
author: Junel S.

description:
Great beer selection - something like 30 beers on tap AND they've got a little of everything; Stone, Green Flash, Drakes, Alagash, Bear Republic, Heretic, etc. etc. etc. 
Try the Pickle Back shot. It sounds bad, but it's actually really good. Their fried pickles are good too!
author: Rich P.

description:
I don't know why it took me so long to review this place. It rocks. 

Delicious sandwiches; Pittsburgh-themed; football Sundays -- everything's good, except they serve The Hatchet, which is by far the worst hard cider.

They could have more of their TVs show the Steelers and not the other games. We have to crane our necks in weird angles to watch the game, unless we want to watch some other dumb game or if we crawl out of bed to get there super-early.
author: J K.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1002.

More of 3.5 stars.

A newer sports bar that has opened for a couple months are with quite a few TVs to make sure you don't miss a moment of sports, and with quite a few bar style seats with a couple communal tables and some seated areas to the side.

Generally I'm not a big sports fan. Generally I really don't like the Marina scene. Generally wine has a better appearance to my palate .

But maybe it's because it's a long day, maybe it's a slow Monday night, or maybe it's a chilled relaxing evening at the new addition of the Mission that has has raw wood beige door, this evening, Giordano Bros, just fitted right with my mood. A decent list of beer on tap (Tripel was pretty good), and a simple but good and tall Kielbasa sandwich with fries and good smoked sausage were all good taste. Stainless steel instead of typical wooden bar counter was squeaky clean. An unexpected kind of bar in the Mission that somehow worked for me this evening.

Service was relaxing on the night I visited since there were no games and service was pretty good too.
author: T L.

description: Permanently closed (I tried to go 8/22/2015).  Gate is locked and google also shows "permanently closed."
author: Allan P.

description:
So here's my quick run-down of Giordano Bros:

- Lots of TVs (this is a PLUS)
- Wish that the TVs would have SOUND (this is a minus)
- AWESOME list of beers (major plus)
- Food = sandwhiches and apps (sweet!)
- Price = Moderate
- 2 bathrooms
-street parking.

Willingness to show NCSU vs. Syracuse game on the Big Screen in the adjoining room area (MAJOR PLUS)


Thanks!!!!
author: Hiromi N.

description: The bar is better here than the one in North Beach. Staff is always cool. Good food m. Can't complain. Other than that the one in North Beach is definitely less busy.
author: Dwight N.

description:
http://sfist.com/2014/12/04/the_30_best_sandwiches_in_san_franc.php

Eating all the sandwiches. #5

Wednesday, February 11, 2015

Definitely get the Hot Cappicola. Probably get it with an egg. I didn't, I should have gotten the egg. 

Got here around 6pm for dinner before a 7:15pm show at the Roxy. They had the Warriors game on, check. They took our order in under 5 minutes, check. They had a secret SF Beer Week menu, check. 

The beer I wanted was tapped, but the Irish Red recommended by the bartender was excellent.

The slaw on the sandwich is awesome. I'm not a super fry fan, so that was ok, but it works well together as a whole and provided a balance for the hot cappicola. The bread is interesting. Super soft. You would think it needed a little toast, but it actually serves as a way to grip all the insides and keep them together while shoveling them into your mouth. 

We finished with time to spare to get seats, and the Warriors won, so there you go.

Just avoid the shuffleboard bros unless you yourself are such.
author: A. T.

description:
Went here to watch a game with some friends and it was great. Casual atmosphere, attentive & quick servers, lots of TVs, a seriously delicious sandwich and an ice cold pitcher of beer.

I got the Hot Cap with a fried egg and shared it with a friend. It's massive and filled with crispy fries and tasty slaw - I could have easily devoured my own!

Protip: Get a side of wing sauce for dipping or add some crystal hot sauce for extra heat.
author: Mitalee M.

description:
This is a TOTAL dude place. 

I would not suggest for a ladylike woman to go here expecting a civil, good time. 

I had a drink while I waiting on a friend, and the cosmo the bartender made was decent, and affordable. And the sandwich the big, gruff man next to me was eating looked REALLY good. 

A bunch of guys were watching hockey and cheering loudly, and I couldn't care less about hockey and no one would make conversation with me because they were too busy staring at the screen and yelling/.

I will come back here and get one of those amazing sandwiches, but it will be in a to-go box!
author: Alanna R.

description:
Not much to say that hasn't been said. Amazing sandwiches, good beer list and not much else. Not that it needs anything else. 

Knocking off one star because the menus is a bit limited - though what they have is awesome - and for all their taps I wish they had a draft cider.

Small nits aside, this place is a gem.
author: Mike F.

description:
Is it me or I dont get the hype? I got the turkey samich and to say that I was impressed...would be a far cry. 

I have been wanting to try this place out since they were featured on a food network show and was stoked to hear that we were getting our very own. 

Well, I guess those mouth watering shows in HD didnt get me further tha a few bites in! 

The bread, white, and oh so bland. Turkey was fresh and flavorful- so no complaints there. The slaw had vinegar and plenty of black pepper- i didnt mind the taste- but I can imagine that is few and far in between. Oh, and the fries, they were good, but I felt they took away from the actual meat. All in all- Meh! Ill stick with Ikes for now...
author: Michelle I.

description:
This is the best Sports bar in the mission. Hands down. They probably have more TVs than all the other sports bars in the mission combined.
The sandwiches are unique and delicious.
author: Dan H.

description:
Their sandwiches are delicious! The Hot cappicola.. capicola.. (pardon my spelling..) is my favorite.. Has never disappointed me the handful of times I've ordered it. Love their staff.. I've never had a problem being served in a timely manner, even as busy as they get -- And they DO get busy. I usually steer clear from crowded, super busy bars in SF because of issues with not being served, etc, but they have yet to disappoint-- And that's including going there to watch the Niners during the last game of the Superbowl last year. If you need a beer recommendation, try to Dunkelweizen.. Delicious! Pair my favorites -- The Hot Capicola and the Dunkel.. Thank me later ;)

.. Plus I have a crush on the blonde server.. She's just so cutesy and sweet! :) The other bartenders and servers are just as great though, promise!
author: Arlynne S.

description:
This is my favorite place in the city to grab an afternoon beer & catch a baseball game. I usually grab some grub too, because it's damn delicious!

Lots of TV's, sunny outdoor tables, friendly *awesome* service, delicious beers on tap, & Pittsburgh-style sandwiches (read: FRENCH FRIES in your sandwich).

I usually get the Hot Capicola sandwich, which is recommended by the staff. These sandwiches are cheap and BIG. My boyfriend put down two on a particularly hungry day, and our server was agape. 

Check this place out for sure!
author: Keri P.

description: Giordano Brothers is the flat out best sports bar this side of The Pecos!!!  Adam and his employees are the best too and they play awesome freakin show tunes!!!!
author: Scott V.

description: The stuffed pirogies are mouth watering good. The potato and cheese insides melt in your mouth. They had phenomenal buffalo wings that paired well with a creamy blu cheese. The draft selection was on point!
author: James C.

description:
Your eyes don't deceive you: that's a Yuengling sign, and you can get Yuengling here... For $7/bottle. I declined on principle, but I'm sure I'll cave when I miss it enough.

Reasonable prices otherwise on food and beer, and it was Polish-ly delicious!
author: Allison S.

description:
The first time I walked into Giordano Bros, I didn't know what to expect. My friend had suggested we go because they had some good sandwiches. I thought, "Perfect. I love a good sandwich."

Boy, I have to say, my first impression of this place has got me going back every few weeks. I am in love with their pastrami sandwich! They have these all-in-one, Pittsburgh style sandwiches that are simply amazing. They're served on soft/chewy bread (usually not my thing) and stuffed with cheeses, meats, coleslaw, and fries. Yes. Fries. It's an entire meal. 

I have to mention their service too - it's always the same few people that work there, and they're on top of their shit. I've never had a bad experience with them, and I'm glad to keep coming back for the food and service. 

I am definitely a fan, and I recommend their pastrami sandwich.
author: Arnold B.

description: Off the hook food and portions are large! Best of all they have yuengling!!! This I a beer very very popular in the east coast that has never made its way west.
author: Crystal M.

description: Huge sandwiches, slaw and fries on the sandwich are on point with primanti bros. can't wait to come back
author: Kristin D.

description:
The owners are from Pittsburgh and and they're all about it. Be prepared to root for the Steelers if they're on the telly.

Their sandwiches are made Pittsburgh-style which means they're made with white italian bread, coleslaw, fries (yes inside the sandwich), cheese, and your choice of meat. I tried the double egg, kielbasa sausage, and pastrami. The kielbasa was my favorite but overall I thought the sandwiches were just okay. There's too much going on and not much flavor, which just doesn't seem right, and I could have done with a toasted bread. On the upside the sandwiches are fattie and they have awesome onion rings and fresh cut french fries that come in small or large sizes depending on if you like to share. The spicy chicken wings are decent and come with ranch dipping sauce and celery.

There are only 2 bathrooms in the entire place, meaning ya gotta share with the boys, and the lines get really long (esp. on Superbowl Sunday!) They have lots of big screen tvs though and a large projector screen in one room. It was a great place with great energy and our server was very attentive, always checking to make sure we were taken care of and kept bringing us water even after we stopped ordering off the menu.

*note
One person in your group has to put down a credit card to start a tab but you can pay in cash at the end. They take it just to make sure you don't bail. 

Awesome sports bar in the Mission! Super close to 16th St. BART, Dolores Park, and loads of other yummy food spots.
author: Alice L.

description: A unique take on sandwiches with tasty fries and cole slaw infused seamlessly.
author: Yoichi N.

description: I hear great things about this place , finally came to check it out after work and totally disappointed. Its pretty slow when i came in couple people at the bar for the game & 2 tables with customers in the dining room not including me . I sat in the back , waiter came to give me a menu , was ready to order but he never came so i got up to see if I can find him to order . Food was quick but not my favorite , my fries were so salty and pretty hard :(
author: Issa B.

description: Good place to hang out with friends and have some good sandwiches.  If you like Primanti Brothers in Pittsburgh PA you will like this place.  Not as good as the original in Pittsburgh, PA, but as close as you will get in the Bay Area.  Good selection of beer, good pub food, great sandwiches, and a great atmosphere to just hang out for a while.
author: Steven B.

description: Really good fries in sandwich, sandwich. Their appetizers were hit and miss. Beer was good if you know what your looking for. I went during an important sporting event so despite the event, waitering was great. I'd come back again!
author: Brian P.

description: Total waste of time sat in the back waiting for someone to take our order waitstaff standing at bar waiting for drinks. Best 65.00 saved by walking out.
author: Roman S.

description: Meh. Cool atmosphere, but it's a Primanti Brothers knockoff (admittedly) and doesn't do it well. Two flavors of frozen wings doused in sauce were just meh. Had the pastrami sandwich. Meat was seasoned well, but lacking volume. Bread was meh. Wasn't overly impressed with the place.
author: Shawn S.

description:
I too like that there is a sports bar in the Mission, but the TVs were placed so...strange throughout the restaurant.  Maybe the layout makes it hard for a lot of the seats to see TVs? They have a bar side with TVs above the bar where you can watch the game but unfortunately that side didn't have my game on (Eagles...Steelers weren't playing so that wasn't the case).  We sat at the other side in the corner and it was very hard to watch the TV in the middle of the room.  My bf had to watch his game through the reflection of a picture.  They have long, high tables that sit ~10 that you can share with strangers.  I mean, an alright place to watch the game...

I wasn't too impressed with the food. I had eaten before at the location in North Beach and I remember liking it in my drunken state.  I tried the hot capicolla (~6.50) sober at this location and it was two chunks of white bread w meat, cheese and fries inside.  It was just kind of bland.  I guess the spiciness of the capicolla gave it a bit of a taste, but I wasn't a huge fan.  We also got an order of pierogies. I was super excited to see 'homemade' pierogies on the menu, and for $6 I was excited and expecting 3 giant ones.  Instead, you get 3 the size of Mrs. T's (you could get 2 boxes of Mrs. T's at the store for $6). We chose the combo (sweet potatoe, cheese, and pepper and cheese or something) and they were so greasy that you could hardly taste the real flavor.   

So, chill little joint, cool location, nice place for a beer/watch the game, but not a fan of the TV placement (maybe they just need more...replace the fish on the wall) and not a huge fan of the food (we should've listened to the waitress when we asked her which sandwich she preferred...coppa or capicolla...and she said neither). Maybe I just need to try it w different bread if they have it bc I'm past white bread after eating all the great bread in this city.

Lastly, okay selection of beer (about 9 on draft, but like 6 IPAs...yuck~ I like my hefs so had to go w Hoegaarden...but they serve it in a nice tall glass).
author: Jessica S.

description: Sandwiches are amazing!!! I am a vegetarian and got the cheese only which comes with fries and cole slaw on the sandwich I ate every crumb. It cost a little more than 6 bucks and the drinks were super strong. Overall I will be coming again
author: Alexis H.

description:
I can't get enough of this place. Great sandwich, chill ass bar tenders, and COLESLAW....

Hot Cap w/ an egg. No special orders. It's perfect and if you disagree piss off and go get your sando somewhere else w/ the fries on the side like a school girl.
author: John D.

description:
Being new to the area, I stopped by with a group of friends looking for some delicious grub n' beer and we were not disappointed. Here they make all-in-one Pittsburgh style sandwiches that are made with your choice of meat, coleslaw, and french fries on a soft sourdough bread. So if you're the type of person who likes to cram your side dishes into your sandwiches (or even if you're not) you'll love the selection of tasty sandwiches at Giordano Bros. I tried the Coppa sandwich and instantly fell in love. The french fries add great crispy texture to each bite and the coleslaw is just the right amount of tangy.

I heard this place really gets poppin' during sporting events (note: does anyone actually use the word 'poppin' anymore?) Anyway... my group arrived shortly before the end of a playoff game in which the Pittsburgh Penguins lost, so the mood was surly at best... definitely NOT poppin. You ever been to a funeral attended by a large group of drunk people waiting to attack anyone wearing the opposing teams' colors?? Something like that. If you're a sports fan you'll understand, so I'm not going to deduct any points for that today. Better luck next time, guys.

So we stood in a corner anxiously waiting for some Penguin fan to stumble out so that he could cry into his ketchup stained Lemieux jersey in privacy. The place cleared out and the waitress was quick to clear a table, offer us menus and take our drink orders. You gotta love fast service like that. With the tension decreased we were soon surrounded by chatty locals and other visitors who had made the trek to enjoy some delicious grub. Then we all lived happily ever after...

No, wait, hold on a second.... I should mention that this is a Steelers / Penguins bar so if you want to show up on Sunday wearing your Niner red and gold, or your Raider silver and black, you'll be disappointed to know that they give priority to Pittsburgh games. 

Overall, great food and a good selection of brews, and the atmosphere was perfect for a night out... that's all you can really ask for, right? Oh! AND most importantly, the bathroom was clean. You heard it, CLEAN. I don't know about you but bathroom cleanliness is a big thing for me, and after my visit / inspection, you can literally rest easy knowing you'll do it in a clean environment. 

They have another location on 303 Columbus avenue, so if you're ever in the city try this place. Cheers!
author: Alex A.

description:
Best place in the mission to watch sports while getting drunk (or the other way around). There's not a spot in the bar where you dont have a good view of a TV, and a few prime spots that puts you right in front of a huge screen.

I came here twice to watch Stanford stomp UCLA, and was disappointed by neither the bar nor the outcome of the game. There were plenty of other fans from both sides adding to the atmosphere on game day, and the pride at the end. The servers were attentive and actually came around to ask if you want to order, collect your used plates and glasses, etc. so you won't have to miss a moment of the game.

I'll admit there's nothing super special good or bad about their sandwiches, wings or beer, but then if it did then this would just be too good to be true and I'd come here for reasons other than to watch a football game.
author: Jason C.

description: Amazing value and delicious food. I had a steak sandwich with a fried egg on top ($6.95 + $0.50 for egg) and it was fantastic. The beer-battered onion rings ($4.95 for large) were the best onion rings I've had in a while. You know how the onions always come out of the onion rings at normal places? Not so at this place. I can't wait to come back here again.
author: Ted W.

description:
Great sandwiches. Not for the calorie counter. Great for watching games on the big screens and being loud with your friends.

Food: John, in the North Beach location, created "The Godfather." My bf seems to like it because it's huge and has everything a meat lover would want on it, including a fried egg. I prefer the smaller pastrami sandwich. 
Quantity: You'll feel bloated after eating
Price: Cheap
Ambience: Sports bar; college vibe, but not a college hangout; no butt cracks
Attire: Whatevs
Service: Fast
Parking: Best to take public transportation
Recommendations: Skip out on the fried pickles. It's okay, but nothing special about it. Cold beer with your sandwich is muy beuno! 

Overall: solid 4
author: Annie T.

description:
Id say its a little over rated. Good concept but lacking in execution. The idea of fries and slaw on my sandwich is a good one ... too bad the slaw is crappy and the fries are soggy :(     meh
Good beer selection though... and sidewalk seating!
author: Jeremy R.

description: Love to come here for the steak sandwich. They also have a great beer selection. Perfect place to watch a Giants game or take a lunch break. Really friendly staff too. And if you're a Pittsburgh sports fan, then you will absolutely love this place.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Came here on 11/16.

I've been here multiple times and had a good time but my last visit will make me not come back.

Waitress took our orders, most of our food came on time except one of our sandwiches and an appetizer.

I had heard the bell ring from the kitchen about 10-15minutes prior to me asking my waitress what was going on with our order.

Mind you, the waitress never checked the kitchen to see if anything food was needed to be picked. 

Well I ask my waitress if there was an update if our food was ready and she said "yeahhhhhhhhhh thatsss weeeiiirrrrrddddd. Let me go checkkkkkk"

And in my head I thought "yeah my food is going to be there I guarantee it"

As she goes by the kitchen. She throws her hands up in the air, looks at us, smiles and says "Looks like the food just came out"

Yeah... if only it tasted like it just came out.... 

Food wasn't hot more like i just took it out of the microwave, went to go do some stuff and then came back to eat my food warm.

The sandwich was cold from the outside and my fried pickles were luke warm.

When you get this type of service, do you believe that the waitress deserves a tip?

Definition of a tip "a sum of money given to someone as a reward for their services"

Well I believe she did not earn her reward for the type of service she gave me because she had forgotten about our food.

I did not throw a fit, i did not complain. I paid my balance in full but on the tip i left a crossed out line and signed my name.

I thought, "well you didn't check on our food. Our food was cold because we got it 20 minutes after it was made, she doesn't deserve a tip".

I could have a been a true asshole, ate my food and said "This food was cold! I refuse to pay for it!" But I didn't....

Now what happened after I paid and gave her my signed receipt???

She goes to her friend, another waitress and tells her that we didn't tip.

The other waitress comes to our table and says "Why did you guys not leave a tip?"

I found that very rude. You don't approach a customer in that matter. She basically said "Hey I deserve a tip! Where is my tip, i served you food".

Instead her approach should have been "I just wanted to see how your dining experience was with us, and if we could improve in any sort of way."

That would have been much better then "why didn't you leave a tip, whats going on?"

Well after that instance, I can definitely say I cannot come back to this bar. 

Thanks anyways.....

I knew I should've just been blunt with her in the first place, I don't like confrontation which is why I leave this yelp review.

I would still recommend this place for food and drinks
author: Cesar F.

description:
I think I could live here.  There are like 5 TVs, delicious food and a great variety of beers.  It's also very close to where to my apartment, so coming here is easy and convenient.  

Let's begin with the food.  Hot Capicola with a fried egg.  That has been my go to sandwich.  It consists of the hot capicola, a fried egg, tasty french fries, and a vinegary slaw between 2 slices of bread.  This combination is magic.  Salty meat, sour slaw, and rich egg yolk make me so happy.  To make it even better, I get a side order of small fried pickles with a thick ranch dipping sauce.  Fried pickles are hard to find, so I get them where I can find them. 

I find that the servers are always friendly and helpful if you need a recommendation for beer or food.  They're also open throughout the day for day drinking and watching sports.  It's like a jock's dream come true.  Although I'm not a jock, I still love this place and like I said, I could live here.
author: Aaron G.

description: cool sports bar! Come here on football sundays and you will find fans of every team here. They have a great selection of beers as well.  Can't wait to come back to try their Philly Style sandwiches!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I really like this place, and I cannot wait to go back.
I went to Giordano Bros. on a busy Thursday night full of Pac-12, Big-12, and NFL football.  The happy hour price is usually $4 for a nice microbrew.  And do believe the hype; the hot capricola is delicious.  Over the duration of the night I had three humbolt brown ales and the hot capricola sandwich, and the tab came out to $21, before tip.  
One of the downsides is the clientele: unfortunate corporate gazillioner guys who are toasting to "continued success" (really?  that's so douchey).  I won't hold it against Giordano Bros because there's nothing they can do about their customers.
Overall, I highly recommend this place for a beer, a sandwich, and some sports.
author: Andrew J.

description:
I went to Giordano Bros for a lunch meeting. Having known Giordano Bros as a noisy place whenever I went to mail product outside during football games or other sporting events, I was surprised how quiet it is in there during an average lunch.

Having just been exposed to pierogi for the first time (homemade real Polish pierogies) I decided to try Giordano Bros' pierogi. They're much more the Americanized, drier pierogi than the Polish ones. They were pretty good, but I coveted my companion's Pittsburgh-style sandwich, though it looked impossible to eat with hands vs silverware. 

The service was good, and I can see this being a great place for sporting event viewing, for sure. I get it now!
author: Emily M.

description:
Um, yum! Wow! The sandwiches are big and delicious.  With slaw and french fries on the sandwich, be sure to bring your appetite! 

Next time I'll be sure to share the sandwich with a friend and get the appetizer of 3 different pierogies because those were some of the best I've ever had!

I can't wait to go back!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Sorry Pittsburgh, I'm not a Steelers fan. However, I am in love with someone who is...so I make sacrifices and watch Steelers game every now and then.

We walked into Giordano Bros to watch the Steelers vs. Cowboys game last weekend. We showed up a little later than expected, so of course all the tables and booths were taken. We were able to stand along the back wall and watch one of their 10 giant flat screen TVs.

Even though the place was packed, the servers were totally efficient and organized. We were offered drinks and food throughout the game, and when orders were placed, they arrived relatively quickly.

I liked Giordano's selection of sandwiches, packed with flavors that one can only find in Steel City (Hot Cappicola, Coppa). Draft beer selection is plentiful so there will be something for everyone.

Con: 1 unisex bathroom for everyone. It can cause quite the wait in line.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Waitresses are snooty and kinda clueless. Bartenders can be pretty rude. I wanna like this place because we need a sports bar in the Mission, but I feel like a bunch of Marina bros n hoes work here. Wish this place was more chill with nicer employees.
author: A L.

description: I was really lucky to have been able to stay in this area when I just moved here, as so many areas are within walking distance (Mission and Noe Valley). This was my first time here, and it was pretty good. Place is a sports bar with a ton of tv's around. I had the Coppa, which was really good--having the french fries on it just sent me to gluttony heaven. I paired it w/the fried pickles, which I'm told is a must here. They were equally good. My only complaint is that the waitress was kind of pushy in letting us know that we couldn't sit at a larger table with only three people and when it got crowded we'd have to move. We ended up finding a smaller table and moved before that could happen, but that stands out as one of my only drawbacks. Parking is kind of tough here, so say a prayer and take a leap of faith around the corner. Or feed the beast and pay the meter.
author: Dan M.

description: Very cool joint to check out.  These folks are very busy especially on a warm day when a soccer game is playing.  I had the turkey sandwich, was good and I couple of margaritas while I watched the game.  It's in a great area in the Mission Dist.  I will be checking this place out again for sure.
author: Liz D.

description:
-Good sandwiches served with fries and cole slaw on wax paper just like Pittsburgh's Primanti Bros.
-Owner really is from the Pittsburgh area
-Pittsburgh paraphernalia on the walls
-Visible TV's-we saw the US women's soccer team score 4 goals in less time than it took to eat our sandwiches
-Good martini-well-priced with ample gin.  
-2 blocks from 16th St. BART station.
-Looking forward to visiting during a Steeler game.
author: Myles L.

description: My 5-star review is in the context of a friendly sports bar during a game. Came with a Pittsburgh friend to watch a Penguins game. The sandwiches were excellent -- I seriously considered ordering a second even though I was already full. A great beer selection at reasonable prices, and a shuffleboard table in the back. I'll be back on a non-game day to hang around with friends.
author: Dan C.

description: Great place to watch games. Great bar food. I feel like tap beer needs to be updated more. Go Packers.
author: Ben H.

description:
Great wings, awesome sandwiches and good beer. Staff is always courteous and quick to serve you no matter how busy.  

My only con is they are a Steeler bar! Go Niners!
author: John R.

description:
3.5 stars

We ate here one night when Truly Mediterranean across the street was out of lamb shwarma. We ate the Hot Capp & the Turkey (sandwich).  Both were quite tasty.  We got a side of fried pickles- these were disappointing, the pickles were too vinegary.
author: Christy L.

description: Great sandwiches, fantastic draft beer selection, and lots of TVs to watch sports on.  The capicola sandwich (get the fried egg!!) was awesome!!  Two friends got the coppa and steak, which were both deemed great as well. The coleslaw in the sandwiches was surprisingly good -- I wanted just an entire order of just coleslaw!  The onion rings were perfectly fried and the onions don't peel out as you eat them.  Would definitely go back to watch a game.
author: Michael C.

description: Went with my wife to watch the Lightning game. Although we were the only two Lightning fans amongst about 20 Blackhawk fans, we were welcome and actually made a couple of friends. Bartender was awesome. Beer list was excellent. Food menu could use some tweaking but all in all it worked.
author: Nate C.

description: Best sports bar in the mission, hands down. Sandwiches are authentic to Pittsburgh and the beer selection is great. Perfect for Warriors games, or to see any Pittsburgh teams.
author: Drew M.

description:
Not at all what I expected, and I mean that in the best way possible.   

Great place to watch a ball game.  Leave your silly bikes and your 30 inch waistlines somewhere down Valencia - and stay there!
author: Eric L.

description: I love this place.  It's nice to have it as an entity, including their second North Beach location. In a time of fancy, overpriced and overrated food in the city ,this place is straight up and you get what you pay for.  The hot capicola is fantastic.  Get it with a fried egg.  Their house made pickles are wonderful tool.  It's the only place I've experienced where the beer prices are reasonable as well.  5 dollar Stella in a nice Stella glass?  Never have I seen this for less than 7 or 8 bucks.  Their beer selection is incredible and the staff is friendly and knowledgable.  Check it out.  It's great for tight budgets too.  Where else can you find a great sandwich for 7 dollars that will probably last two meals?  Nowhere.
author: Zach H.

description: Average sports bar - not spacious, very loud, OK food (I had the pierogis).
author: Emily W.

description: First off, this is a very good imitation of Primanti Bros in PIT, except their coleslaw is not as good. Second, Inside is a bit small a bit pricey but I guess its standard fare for SF. Good for a baseball game, but way too crowded for the NBA finals; with their local GS warriors going for a ring not hard to see why.
author: Edward P.

description:
Their sandwiches are the shiznit!  Sooo decadent, a pork-filled greasy heaven, layer upon layer of meat, cole slaw, buffalo sauce, a fried egg, more meat, french fries, and other stuff.  This place will take you to the heart of flavor country.

The sandwiches are Pittsburgh-style, which means everything comes inside the sandwich.  I highly recommend the salami or the pastrami sandwiches.  And definitely get it with buffalo sauce and fried egg.

They also have lots of beers and cocktails, and a nice long happy hour.  If there is a good game on tv, this place is ideal.  Especially for giants baseball, great place to kick back and drink some beer while shouting at the tv.  And when the game is over, head next door to picaro for some sangria!

There is nothing healthy on the menu, so if you're a vegetarian just walk away.  Also there are no burgers!  Only deli meat, though the meat is hot and the sandwich is so filling you'll feel like you ate a burger.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
We came in here blind looking to snack while waiting for a ridiculous 3 hours to get a table at Monk's Kettle across the street. I'm glad we stumbled into this place because it turned out to be pretty good.

We ordered a pitcher of beer (don't remember the name), steak sandwich, pierogis, and buffalo wings. I really liked the sandwich here. The meat was nice and tender, and it came with a lot of it. The fries inside the sandwich were unexpected and delicious. Pierogis were decent, I had never had one before. They're essentially pot sticker dumplings filled with potato. Wings were just okay, nothing special. 

It's a nice place to hang out and watch the game. They have plenty of TVs and a pretty good selection of beers on tap.
author: Kevin N.

description:
I've been here twice and I've become a fan of their all-in-one sandwiches. The bar and eatery has a cool vibe and houses two sit-down rooms. I've noticed that it's pretty dark at night, but it works for the most part, especially with their over-sized flat-screens. The two times I've come by it's been too cold to enjoy my dinner outside, so I've stuck to sitting indoors. It get's pretty loud, with the beer flowing, the shuffle board going, and the sports playing, so don't expect a quiet meal.

Giordano has a serious selection of brews and beer connoisseurs will definitely feel right at home. I'm on a hiatus from drinking, but fans of beer will undoubtedly love the endless selection of beers. My friend kept raving about their sandwiches, and I was ready to try the hype. The menu is short and to the point with 10 different sandwiches, as well as few add-on's, and side dishes. I debated on either the turkey or the steak and went with the latter.

The steak sandwich for $7 is a flavorful bargain. The sandwich itself: two thick pieces of French bread, sandwiched between steak and melted cheese, coleslaw and fries. When I heard the fries were IN the sandwich, I was hesitant, but decided to not mess with their formula. I'm glad I didn't. The end result was amazing. The coleslaw was not mayo based, but instead was drizzled with olive oil and pepper. The fries were crispy and not overstuffed in the sandwich, and somehow, someway, the sandwich held together with the French bread.

It's no wonder why Giordano Bros. always has a steady crowd. The sandwiches are excellent and the beer selection is top-notch. Furthermore, the prices are more than reasonable, especially for the quality of food. I'll admit I almost messed with the sandwich ingredients the first time around, but I highly suggest ordering it as is and experiencing it their way before making any changes. Oh, and don't forget to drizzle your sandwich in their hot sauce!

Ambiance: 4 Stars (out of 5)
Food: 4 Stars (out of 5)
Service: 4 Stars (out of 5)
Price: $
Overall: 5 Stars (out of 5)

Pros:
+ Tasty and delicious sandwiches
+ Quality of food
+ Beer selection
+ Hot sauce
+ Prices
+ Friendly staff
+ Outdoor seating 
+ Flat-screens/ambiance 

Cons:
- Can get crowded
author: Alexander E.

description: It's been several months since I went into Gbros. Went last night to watch the NBA playoffs and wondered why I don't come here more often. Great beer selection, full bar, servers that stay friendly even when dealing with a bunch of jabronis, and amazing sandwiches. Also, they now have salad (comes with Salami, but you can get it without). My vegetarian girlfriend is stoked! Asked my server if they'll be showing the World Cup. She said they'll open at 9am for it. Best of all, Dunkel (my favorite beer) will be $2 off during the games. Can't wait for Thursday!
author: Milo M.

description: There Italian Chopped Salad is awesome!!! At first glance it was small for 10.50 but after inspecting the salad the bowl was deceiving as it was quite deep and filled. Fresh and crisp just like it should be. Oh and don't worry I don't come to this place and JUST eat a salad. I washed it down with onion rings.....and ranch. Beers on tap are great for you hopps lovers. Good spot and a ton more space than their North Beach spot!
author: Bri R.

description: Great place to hang out with friends and catch a sporting event or game on tv. We watched a hockey game and the communal tables were conducive to meeting people. Great beers on tap and friendly servers. YUMMY food!
author: Tina P.

description:
Two words: Hot Capp. 

I feel like fk'n one up right now. mmmdamn.
author: jerrod v.

description: Awesome bar in the mission! One of my favorites. Plus their onion rings ARE TO DIE FOR.
author: Becca S.

description: So many amazing food options in SF, but I still make sure I stop here every time I pass through. Nothing fancy. Just simple, great ingredients. One of the few places you can actually watch a fresh potato transform into a golden fry. Nice job, guys.
author: Jake S.

description: Hands down THE BEST wings in the city. As the bartender said "not all wings are created equal" and these are perfect with a sauce I could drink. Excellent service, with great viewing of the TV's and sandwiches that I only wish my stomach could fit all of it because it is so TASTY!
author: Dhwani P.

description: We stopped by here after having a few drinks at Elixir down the street. I can honestly say the sandwiches were even better than Primanti Bro's in Pittsburgh. We tried all 3 of their pierogis, and they were all excellent. To top it off, they had a great beer selection.
author: Hershel C.

description:
So usually I'm not a big fan of mixing things together. The sound of sandwiches + fries + coleslaw kind of mortified me at first, but it's surprisingly good. 

I had the hot link sandwich:
- Hot link: Juicy & spicy 
- Fries: Even though they were in the sandwich, they remained their crispiness
