- Coleslaw: Fresh and tart (?) 
- Sourdough bread: Soft / fluffy and not soggy!

Came here for the Superbowl, great service and awesome atmosphere.
author: Grace Y.

description: my buffalo wings unexpectedly came with a side of celery and ranch--my fave. service was fast, friendly, delicious food and they were playing the Warriors game.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
All the 4- and 5-star reviewers definitely have a different take on sandwiches than I do. The fries are pretty good (it's hard to mess up fries) but the sandwiches...man. The combination of white bread, greasy meats, mayonnaise-laden cole slaw and fries should taste delicious, right? But it doesn't. It's like the worst of all possible worlds: heavy, bland, and gummy. 

I have no problems with drinking beer in a pleasant patio on a hot day. I just wish the sandwiches -- which is basically the entire menu -- were tastier. 

My theory is that the sandwiches are basically designed to sell more beer with the minimum investment in sandwich ingredients. White bread, fries, slaw...it's all pretty cheap. And they save in volume by varying only the meat inside and not providing different condiments or vegetables. It's a good racket, I guess. And most of the customers don't seem to be complaining. So while I'll never be going back to Giordano Bros, I think they'll probably stick around.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I met up with some friends at this bar for the Super Bowl. The bar is very accessible, being about a block and a half up from the 16th Street BART.  The atmosphere was great, a good split between Patriots and Giants fans. Having lived and gone to school in New England, I adopted them as my second home team. Plus, Tom Brady is a Bay Area native!

The bar spans across two different rooms, and one room had a huge projection screen showcasing the game. Additionally, there are about 5-7 LCD flat panels all throughout both rooms of the bar. There are not a lot of tabled seats in the left bar, but the right part of bar has a lot of seating. You'll also see a large list of the beers on tap that this establishment carries on the right side.

Beers seem reasonably priced. I had a couple drafts of a Guiness Dark. Made a large order of Chicken wings and that was enough for 3 dudes to snack on during the game. The Chicken wings came drenched in BBQ sauce, which was a Gift & Curse all wrapped into one. The sauce was good, but it was just so much it was gooping all over the place. What's that Carl's Jr. motto, "If it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face"?

Anyway, the bar filled in with a lot of over zealous New York Giants fans, and the Patriots threw a Hail Mary pass on the last play of the game. Rob Gronkowski was 2 ft from catching it and that was the end. I came head held high. Left in utter Defeat...But damn those wings were good!

This place is a pretty fun spot to catch some big games. Definitely, would go again.
author: Michael C.

description: Very solid sandwiches, ordered a steak sandwich with a fried egg. The fries they add to the sandwich are fantastic and fried egg were worth it. Might want to try a different meat next time as the steak was overpowered by the coleslaw and fries.
author: Rob G.

description:
Being from Pittsburgh, this is closest thing to a Primanti's Bros. sandwich that you can find outside of the Steel City.
We held our Fantasy Football Draft in the Mission location and the staff and management were more than accommodating.  We are going back this year to do it again.
My mouth is watering, just thinking of the Hot Capicola with Fried Egg.
author: dorindam m.

description: Delicious sandwiches and friendly staff, cool for football. Would come back just for the sangwiches any day
author: Kimberly B.

description: Well below average. Ordered the buffalo wings which were not crispy but very dry in the middle so cooked for too long too low. Service was crap. I asked for to close my tab (I hadn't even opened one, I just wanted to pay for my drinks right away but my server obviously thought I wanted them to keep my card). When I asked another server to close my tab he said I had to go and walk to the other side of the bar and talk to the girls even though the girl who had taken my card was within arms reach but with another customer. I saw parties beside us leave without tipping and heard them talking about the poor service too. Not enough staff on, and the few who were on weren't great. Won't be back, would not recommend this place.
author: M F.

description: I moved here from Chicago, and I was really missing Lucky's (same thing, just in Chicago). I accidentally found this place, and it made me so happy! Sandwiches are delicious, they have french fries on top! My favorite is the Hot Capicola - it's fantastic. To top it off, they have an excellent beer selection (Franziskaner, Weihenstephaner Dunkelweizen, Tripel Karmeliet). They have shuffleboard too which is cool. I've been here a couple times, it's always got a good amount of people - popular but not too crowded.
author: Brett N.

description:
I really do not get why this place gets such high reviews. Went here last night with my  husband and daughter, and was really not impressed at all. Daughter & I split the steak sandwich, which was incredibly bland. I did not care for it at all and only ate a couple bites of my half. Husband had the spicy sausage and liked his slightly better. We definitely would not go back for the sandwiches.

We ordered a side of onion rings which were pretty good. That, and because the server was very nice, is the only reason this place gets 2 stars instead of 1.
author: Tara M.

description:
The sandwiches are tasty, however they only put a very small amount of meat on them. It's really mostly slaw. I had the coppa with an egg and the only thing it was lacking was more coppa. 

Come on guys, step it up on the meat.
author: Craig I.

description: Great spot, good food, and lot's of sports, if that's what you're into.  I go for the food and to chit chat with the staff, who are all rad.  My boyfriend goes for the baseball games on the big screen. Lots of good beer on draught too!
author: Leslie H.

description: What a shame. Great location with a great atmosphere, unfortunately that's where the it ends. The service is absolutely terrible, I don't think I should have to beg for a drink.  I think if you take my empty glass you should at least ask if I want another. Unfriendly customer service to the extreme, as I'm writing this there are three people sitting at the bar and my fiancé has an empty glass and no one has notice for quite some time. Let's move on to the facilities, all these people here " working" and nobody can take the damn trash out? The can is literally overflowing onto the floor and top of the toilet in a unisex bathroom.  Maybe it's management, I don't know but could be 5 stars when it's only gonna get a one from me. Btw, my fiancé still hasn't been asked for another drink. We're gonna leave now.
author: Jamie L.

description:
loved that they had packets of crystal hot sauce! i also love fries in my burgers and a vinegary sandwich, so this place was right up my alley!

this was a perfect little sandwich with all the right combinations - coppa, vinegar slaw, fries, and, of course, CRYSTAL! yum!
author: Marjie T.

description:
Hot and friendly staff keep the Pittsburgh spirit alive in SF!

Gonna try to go back and watch a Penguins game soon :-)

pierogies - a lil expensive but so good

Primanti's style sandwiches - it's definitely not Mancini's bread, but otherwise it's a nice imitation, tasty cole slaw

Kennywood signs are perfect, not sure about the taxidermic animals all over the place ...

Steelers games. this season sucked, but the Steel Curtain crowd is solid at this joint. Great place for day drinking. You can even see the games on the big screens from the patio sometimes.

I only wish the 49ers and the Patriots could both lose this weekend...

GO STEELERS!
author: Mary H.

description:
Wait, what?  This is what replaced Ti Couz?  Really?  Bland-ass whitebread-and-soggy-french-fry sandwiches with a teensy weensy sliver of meat and maybe (if you're lucky) a miniscule drizzle of cheap olive oil?  What a f***ing joke.  Seriously, it's like subway with french fries on it.  

As if the lousy food weren't enough, there's the also the attitude.  While I was sitting there trying to eat the crappy carb explosion they call a sandwich, trying not to gag from the overwhelming dryness of it, I overheard some poor girl who had the audacity to ask if they'd be willing to turn the tv to the giants game... you know, the San Francisco Giants? The baseball team of the city you're actually physically IN?  They refused!  Instead they left all the tv's on some ridiculous "exhibition" game between a couple of bottom-tier NFL teams from the deepest depths of the flyover that only three or four San Franciscans have actually even heard of.

Pitiful.   As sad as it was to see Ti Couz go, I'm the first to say that there're all kinds of businesses that would have made sense for this particular spot.  A douchebag frat bar with flavorless food isn't one of them.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Amazing sandwiches! Be sure to get them with egg. The buffalo wings are also awesome. 

If you go in a large group, make sure that you pay with cash. Myself and my co-worker were the only two people who paid with a card in our group of 8. The waitress charged the entire bill to my card and my co-workers card, including our shares of the bill. We didn't notice until the next day and had to call the manager to complain. He said "Oh this happens about once a month. The charges will drop off in a few days." First off, this shouldn't be happening, especially as frequently as once a month. Second, that is horrible customer service. How do you know if you waitress is stealing from your customers?
author: Sandra F.

description:
This is a great bar if you want to see how good your credit card fraud department is.  I went there recently and, even though there was no one in the bar, the bartender insisted I give him a credit card to "run a tab" if I was going to order food.  I told him I would pay in cash and he said it's just their policy.  I gave him a card I NEVER use and a few days later, I get a call from the fraud department about some suspicious charges.
Do I know it was them?  -A lawyer would say no, but I haven't used that card in months, so it seems likely the guy who insisted he needed a card for an order under $20 stole the number.
Also, the wings are vastly over-rated.  If you get an order of 10 wings this is what you should expect: 9 wings and 1 drum, which is awful cheap on their part.
I've lived in this neighborhood for over 20 years and none of my neighbors ever says "Meet me at Giordano Bros."  I wish they stayed in North Beach.
author: Jeff C.

description: Great place to watch sports. We came here for the rosebowl and enjoyed the gigantic televisions and assortment of beer.
author: Eliza D.

description:
To paraphrase Joey Tribbiani:
Meat... good.
Fresh Italian bread... good
Melted Provolone... good
Coleslaw... good
Fresh-cut fries... good
Fried egg... good

Put it all together... very good.
Combine it with a killer beer selection, friendly service and plenty of seating... fantastically good.

Best Pittsburgh-style sandwich this side of the Mississippi.  Had the pastrami with fried egg and an order of onion rings.  Awesome.  The fried egg truly elevates the sandwich. They also have true happy hour prices on their beers, usually about $3 for a pint. Pitt prices in San Francisco?
author: Alex R.

description:
so very glad that this place is here!  They've transformed the former Ti Couz space just beautifully with a bar in each of two rooms, each room with three (?) televisions with different events on each.  The beer list is huge and the Pittsburgh style sandwich list is comprehensive.  The staff was so friendly.  

I had the hot capicolla sandwich and a Turtle Creek pale ale.  That ale was wonderful: on the light side with a lovely bite.  It would be perfect for a hot day with its 'drink it right down" quality, or for a cool night with that bite.  The sandwich was good.. Pittsburgh style includes french fries on the sandwich, which I though I would find to be to heavy but this was not the case.  The meat was perfect...with a spiciness to it but not to much. The coleslaw that topped the sandwich was vinegar based and the shred was the perfect size.  

Finally!  a place to come and watch the sports events of the day and have a beer and a sandwich in a neighborhood bar with nice people Awesome!
author: Unemployed D.

description:
We stumbled into this place while visiting the city yesterday. We were starving and decided to just pick the next place that looked decent. We were pleasantly surprised. This is the kind of place we need in Monterey/Salinas. 

They have a simple menu,  One  awesome sandwich that is prepared with french fries and coleslaw. You pick you your meat (Italian sausage for me, Hot capicola for the boyfriend) and if you so wish add an extra side. (onion rings for us).

It's as simple as that but tastes so good. They have plenty of beers on tap, tv screens to watch sports, and even have live music in the evenings. 

Our waitress was really nice and kept our drinks filled. I would love it if we had a place like this where we live. 

My only critique I guess would be that the slaw could have a bit more flavor. Was mainly just oil and vinegar- but still tasted good.  Definitely cured our hunger!
author: Rose H.

description:
Giordano Bros. in North Beach makes pretty much my favorite sandwiches in the world, so when I saw they opened a Giordano Bros. in the mission I was down to check it out.

When I first came in I noticed the the mish version of GB was much larger, but had a different ambiance.  Whereas the North Beach GB has the feel of an old school sports bar, this one is more hipster chic.  Still has lots of big flatscreens to catch the game on though.

The beer list here is great, lots of different options and some really tasty draughts.  The service is also great, both the dude who was the manager and the girl bartending were awesome.

As for the food, it's just as good as at their other location.  Their sandwiches are the meat of your choice, heated up with provolone cheese, an oil and vinegar coleslaw, and french fries, all between two slices of thick cut bread.  You can add a fried egg for fifty cents.  Hot sauce on the side FTW.  I got a steak and egg sandwich and it was delectable.

After our sandwiches we got some hot wings, and the wings they make are on point as well.  Great spot, great food, great beer, and great service, I'll definitely return many times.
author: Brad R.

description: Best sandwiches ever! Seriously, they put hand cut fries on it. They also have lots of tvs and lots of beers.
author: Teresa D.

description:
Great spot!  The atmosphere is nice and the ceilings are high.  

Had the Kielbasa Sandwich - delicious!  The meat was juicy, the cole slaw was light (I hate when there's too much vinegar), and the french fries were crispy.  Note, french fries are inside the sandwich not on the side.  Fried pickles came out sizzling hot.  They were crispy and perfect in the hot wings dipping sauce.  

We even had time to play shuffle board... 15-9 anh!
author: Anh D.

description:
What is there not to like about Giordano Bros?

Soft tasty bread? like it
Salty italian meats? yes please
Tangy coleslaw that's not too mayonaise-y? sweetness
French Fries? f*ck yeah
Optional fried egg? broner time

Add in some good beers, TVs, and shuffleboard. Done. Thank you Giordano Bros.
author: Young L.

description: I visited SF for the weekend and stumbled into Giordano Bros because the bar tender's shirt had the Pittsburgh Penguins logo on it and I was trying to watch some Ducks hockey. The food and beer selection was incredible. I ended up going back every day for food and hockey. The guys were really cool about putting our hockey game on, even during the World Series. Can't wait to come back, I even bought a shirt.
author: Josh K.

description: Awesome new sports bar in the Mish replacing Ti Couz to complement all the hipster & dive bars.  HD TVs and decent happy hour 5-7pm (for now)!  Known for their N Beach location and die hard Pitts fans, go check out the all-in-one sammys (fries n slaw in the sandwich and cookie (choc chip, PB, rice krispies combined)!!!  My hot capicola Sammy was awesome on soft white bread but could've used more meat.  Cookie a lil' dry but just washed it down with some HH beer.  They even carry some upscale stuff like Belgian ales in addition to your staples like Coors...
author: kiwi l.

description: One of my fondest memories from grad school, and there are many, is sliding into a booth at 2am with a soon to be fulfilled vision of a double egg with a side of chili and a coke plopped in from of me. Now that's comfort food. Grad school and those Primanti Brothers sandwiches are a long way off, in Pittsburgh to be precise. But with Giordano Brothers now in residence in the Mission, those good memories are just a few blocks and a few bites away. They definitely know how to make a good Pittsburgh-style sandwich. The fries are crisp, the slaw is cold snd tangy, the bread is soft and cut thick, and regardless of which one you choose, you need both hands. My double egg was delish. I also enjoyed the pierogies, which were topped with sauteed onion just the way mama Mikus used to make them. I kind of wished for a bit of sour cream, but it was ok to go without. With all those tvs and guys in plaid, I almost felt transported to the south side or the Strip district. The Pittsburgh experience would have been complete if only they had some Yuengling on tap, but I don't think it gets distributed this side of the Rockies:( My Scrimshaw pilsner worked just fine, but it just wasn't the same. We had pretty good service. I especially liked the guy from the kitchen who was super excited about the pierogies. He rattled off several other kinds he makes that weren't on the menu. All of which sounded pretty yummy. Thinking about pierogies also got me thinking about the pierogie pizzas from Church Brewworks.  So, if at all possible, would you guys consider slipping a pierogie pizza in as a special? Maybe on a Sunday during football season? Being able to watch Big Ben and the boys with a cold brew and some Pittsburgh-style grub would totally make my weekend. I even promise to wear flannel too.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Checked out this place on opening night. Was pretty full for the steelers preseason game. Lots of cheers all around as they racked up the score vs the Eagles in the first half. Good TVs all around, although a few seats don't have very good views.

Sampled the turkey sandwich which was filled mostly with yummy fries - done in true Pittsburgh style. Maybe a few too many fries but that's not something a person should really complain about.

I need to try the Kolbassi next time!
author: Dave K.

description:
Giordano Bros is amazing!

Meaty, slaw-y, friench fried goodness. I don't go to drink beer, I don't go to watch sports. I just go to eat crazy good sandwiches. If, for some reason, you've never been... you need to go.

And now I can eat it without going to North Beach!? Life is good.
author: jared c.

description:
$5 dollar Green Flash IPAs for happy hour!

Sandwiches similar to Primanti Bros of Pittsburgh, you're getting a meal in between two pieces of white bread. The history behind this sort of sandwich was that it was made for truckers, who always had one hand on the wheel and one hand on the sandwich.

Go for the Coppa. Salty pork that was almost serrano ham-like in flavor, along with sweet and fresh coleslaw that wasn't overly mayo'd or vinegar'd up, hot french fries that were thicker cut, yet still crispy, and a tomato slice for more freshness sandwiched between two pieces of white bread. This thing was amazing. A lot of heavy flavors from the fries and pork being balanced out nicely by the slaw and tomato. I recommend putting a ton of crystal sauce... crystal sauce is freaking awesome. My only gripe was that the white bread got mushy after awhile... but man this thing is good.

The onion rings were also very good. Crispy beer battered circles of awesome.

The periole? I don't know how to spell it, but its similar to gnocchi inside a ravioli. Freaking delicious. Potatoes combined with garlic and parmesean cheese, steamed, then pan seared, create this amazing doughy/garlicky/potatoey goodness.

The chicken wings were fairly standard, but very vinegary, so if you're into that stuff, you'll love them. The buffalo sauce I'm sure is also made from Crystal sauce, and there are a lot of peppers, so you get this added pepper kick.

I'd come back for the sandwich.
author: Marc T.

description:
Ok so I have not been to the famous Primanti Bros in Pittsburgh but if Giordano Bros is any indicator of how good it is then get my to the Burg...NOW!

The meat used here is from Molinari's in North Beach so already GioBros are off to a good start.

I had the coppa with the egg. Crazy good, the coppa is fried and serves as a good foundation for the Fries, Slaw, Cheese, an Egg that is stuffed between two breads. The first bite is pretty damn memorable as everything works together. 

I do wish the slaw had a bit more vinegar tang, but im nitpicking, the crunchy texture is a good contrast to all the other ingredients.

Whats also great is that the sandwich costs around $7!

The buffalo wings are also solid. Good selection of beer.

But the sandwiches are the main attraction here, and it is has emerged as one of the best in the city.
author: Richard N.

description:
Came here on a Sunday to watch a Steelers game with friends and had a great time

The server was busy but attentive.  I got a turkey sandwich which was a close replica to the ones served at Primanti Bro in PA.  The fries were a bit soggy for my liking

Nice place to watch games for all the different tvs but it does get busy so get there early to grab a spot
author: Ashley P.

description:
We visited here one day, just for some drinks and light snacks, so this review is really just for that.

We saw the pierogies on the menu, and after relaxing next door with some sangria, we thought we would just stop in just for that.  We tried the combo one, with all the flavors - they were all pretty good, but small - and not quite as tasty as I was expecting.  Even though they were all different flavors, I didn't think they tasted different enough.  

One of my friends got a sandwich there too, which I guess they are known for - looked good, but I didn't try any.  My friends got some beers that came with the glasses, which was pretty cool. 

I'll have to come back and try their sandwiches, and give them the benefit of the doubt and then update my review again later.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Better sandwich than you would think. The absence of cheese or sauce makes it taste healthier than you think a sandwich stuffed with fries would be.

Atmosphere is a little on the douchey/sports bar side, but that probably fits in with the Pittsburgh scene.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Nice beer selection, super fast service, sandwiches that knock me over (I miss Primantis but not Pittsburgh, so this alternative is an incredible find), and good music. I couldn't ask for more.

Also, get the pickle. You won't be disappointed. Like you might be by other pickles.
author: Maria D.

description:
Having just come back from a Pittsburgh trip (including the folks who are famous for this sandwich with slaw+fries style: Primanti Brothers), I was thinking that I'd be let down by this place that styles itself after them.  I was pretty happy, though, and actually like the french fries that came on the sandwiches BETTER than Primanti Brothers.  Shocking.  

They did fall short of Primanti's on a couple of other factors, though: the amount of actual food you get is less and the bottom slice of bread gets soaked in slaw juice.  Also, the wait for the food is very long (~20-25 min).  I had the Kielbasa and the wife had Capicola.  Both were very good.  The chicken wings, which we are also kinda snobby about having lived in Buffalo, smelled legit.  Will have to try those next time.

Service was good.  Waitress was very busy and apologized for the long food wait.  She filled my soda several times as we waited so we gave her a nice tip.  Tell those cooks to move their lazy butts!  We'll be back.
author: Desmo K.

description:
I'd only been to the North Beach location once and forgot how much I enjoyed the sandwich. We came in to the new Mission loc on a Wednesday night with no major sporting events so Giordano's was mellow. For the Pittsburgh style sandwich, just stick to the Italian choices, Hot Capicola or Coppa. We got a good inch of sliced meat (winking at the cook on my way to the restroom paid off apparently). It's a whole meal in itself and the balance is perfect with salty meat, French fries, and tangy coleslaw. 

The most expensive sandwich is $7.50 and totally shareable. In a town where a normal deli sandwich is the same price and adding an egg onto anything is $1 (an egg sheesh), here it's 50 cents extra. Not a big fan of the white crumbly sliced bread, but it doesn't look like they'll be changing the formula for Californians who prefer whole grain, cracked wheat, sprouted seed bread. I just had an idea that next time I'll flip my sandwich upside down as soon as I get it so the top dry piece of bread gets some juicy meat lovin' too.

Pierogi come in all different forms and Giordano's is like a potsticker dumpling filled with potato or cheese. I loved the dough but at about $2/piece, my curiosity has been satisfied. Wings were spicy and messy and we even got an extra one. I was super full but I can't believe I missed the all-in-one cookie with rice krispies, choc chips, and peanut butter... I'll be back!
author: Mimi L.

description: My boyfriend is from Pittsburgh, and Gioradno Brothers markets itself on being able to provide a little slice of Pittsburgh here in San Francisco.  A few Burgh decorative items strewn about the bar, and a shuffleboard table (major points).  Good to watch the next game, or grab some beers with friends.
author: Mel G.

description:
"its just meee and you ooooooo baaaaaby " is it weird that im singing to my sandwich???
 Well, if you ate here you would be singing too.
The sandwiches here are sooooooooooo good.
So good I bit my finger because it had some of the coleslaw left on it. 
 The meat taste fresh 
and not foster farms fresh
 but ive been grazing on imported corn from heaven fresh. ( do they have corn in heaven)????
 The waitresses here are beautiful and sweet with wonderful service. they dont rush you to order or slap you for not knowing what you want, when everybody else does. (ok ive never been slapped before but it could happen.)
I love this place
I went two days in a row and if they would let me sleep on the shuffleboard table they have in the reastaurant I would be there everyday.
good quality food, good size portions, good service, for a low price
author: LaNiesha P.

description:
Came for the sandwiches, stayed for the bar. 
These sandos are something special: SOFT bread, wet slaw, and fries come standard ON the sandwich. Sometimes the ladies get them on the side. I vote for Coppa. Go for the extra meat. 
Fifth star is for the most delightful bartendress in SF. 
Oh and they have televisions displaying sporting events if you're into that.
author: steve m.

description:
Went to Giordano Bros. for an impromptu dinner on a Wednesday night.  I had been to the North Beach location a couple years ago, but though I'd check out the new location and try the Pittsburgh style sandwiches again.

These sandwiches sure are deceiving.  They don't look like they'll be that filling, but my two friends and I all agreed that they are much bigger than they look.

My pastrami sandwich was ok.  I've definitely had better pastrami elsewhere, and sometimes I had to fight through some gristle to prevent pulling all the meat out in one bite.  

We also split an order of fries, which were tasty.  Definitely of the freshly hand cut kind and certainly one of the better version of those.

We ordered a pitcher of a delicious Scottish Ale, the name of which I cannot remember.  Service was good and friendly, though the server accidentally added another party's drinks to our tab.  It was quickly resolved and not a problem at all.

If I were to go to Giordano Bros again, I'd just stick with the original location since it's closer to my place.  Definitely would be a fun place to watch a game..
author: Naoko M.

description: Had the pastrami and Turkey sandwich. Unimpressed. That's all I had. The service was nice. The sandwich lacked meat,  the bread needed to be grilled and I couldn't detect any vinaigrette. They didn't have any mayo for the sandwich.
author: reza n.

description: I went to meet up with a good friend who suggested we meet here since she knew the owner. I have a "bucket list" of places to eat before I die, and one of them was a Pittsburg coal miners sammy, perhaps Primanti bros......well, I guess I don't have to go far to have one of these lil coma inducing sandwiches. Last time I went to this place, it was a crepe place, nothing spectacular, then I came here and had the works in a sandwich, egg and buffalo sauce to boot. I ate this fantasticness in less then 5 minutes. I am in love, then I went home and got the full blown "ITIS", it's when you overindulge in something scrumtious and then take a nap, a nap that's more like a roofy induced knock out. I would love to return and take on 3 sandwiches in 15 minutes so I can try and get my name on the wall, this latter was only mentioned but I love a good challenge and I love a good sandwich!
author: Natasha C.

description:
These sandwiches are okay and they have a good selection of sides (fried pickles, pierogis, etc.).

I didn't give it 4 stars because this tries to a be a fancier Primanti Brothers (in Pittsburgh) and the original is way better even though it's more casual.
author: Anton S.

description:
While I would imagine that this place is awesome for watching Steelers games, I have been here two times to watch (NY) Giants games and it has been amazing both times. The place is very clean, very friendly, lively, but laid back type of atmosphere. Even when it gets crowded, there is usually somewhere to sit. There are tons of TVs, although the ginormous projection screen is pretty low quality, Especially in comparison to the ones they have at other places like Jillian's. That being said, they have 65" HD TVs on the wall and the atmosphere and prices are a million times better, so I'm not complaining. 

They have a vast beer selection, which is true of many places. What is different here is that they have a variety of local beers that most local connoisseurs have never even heard of. Personally though, after discovering the Grand Teton red ale, I am completely sold! The beers are $4 and up for pints, Happy Hour is $1 off pints M-F from like 4-6 I think, don't quote me on that. Pitchers are a slightly better deal, maybe save you $2-4. 

The food menu is the only reason they lose a star. They mainly focus on "Pittsburgh style" sandwiches. That's cool. Didn't know Pittsburgh had a sandwich style. The problem is that they just aren't very good. At least the one I tried wasn't. The coleslaw on the sandwich thing, that just made everything really soggy. I know this will make me very unpopular here, but I just really prefer the Philly style of sandwiches much better. The fries were pretty bad too. Moreover, the food is pretty over-priced for what it is. I would have ordered the hot wings, but the price tag was just way too high. 

Despite my food complaints, this place is pretty dope. I don't really go to bars to eat, but if I can find a place that has good food, good beer, AND good football, I am in heaven. For now, I'll settle for this.
author: Miguel V.

description: Delicious double egg sandwiches. Really good beer selection with a great happy hour. Lots of TV's for watching the sports. Friendly wait staff. Can get really crowded, especially during any major sporting event.
author: Eric G.

description:
I have been many of  time to the North Beach location and LOVE the food there. The All-In-One Sando is one of the best things there is to eat! They have such a chose of meets to put on this (AIO) All-In-One that i have not had a chance to try them all yet, but i will be back for the rest!!!!!

The new location is much bigger then the OG location! They have a lot of BIG screens all over the bar and not to mention they have a shuffle board table!! Way to go on that!!! 

The Second (2nd) best thing is the beer on tap. They have  a wide range of Ales to try from all over California's Microbrewery seen. I think that they have over 21 on tap!!!!!  I also want to try them all and only got through a few last night! 

Any one looking for a good meal and a great beer has to stop by the new location in the Mission and try them out!!

Let me know if i am wrong about anything i stated!!!
author: Joshua L.

description:
I felt sorry for the staff that waited on our table on Saturday afternoon.  After being here for 3 hours our group grew rowdier as the afternoon went on.   

We started w/ beer & sandwiches and shared fries, fried pickles, and onion rings.  Service was quite fast and all the food was tasty.  I shared the Hot Coppiola (sp?) and it was quite delicious as all their sandwiches are served "Pittsburgh style" with a vinegary slaw and fries (yummy!)
After 6 or so pitchers the boys moved to the shuffle board table.  They were entertained for about 1.5-2 hours and by all the Saturday college football and MLB baseball games going on with the 4 TV monitors.  

For all the food & beer,  it came out to just over $30 per person x 7 of us.  
It wasn't a full house but just right for our larger group to chill. 
Everyday I'm shufflin'...
author: Meredith K.

description: Wings are amazing. Make it in time for happy hour!, trust me those prices are happy hour prices!! Got the pastrami salami sandwich. hands down, giordano now holds the title in my books as the best sandwich. Good size tv's for any sporting events. Will definitely be back soon. !
author: Carlos I.

description: Great sandwich, simply affordable and a great place to watch football. Killer Bloody Mary's and the fried pickle chips are delicious!!
author: Mike M.

description:
5 stars for being a sports bar in an area that needed one.

4 stars for the food because those all in one's are crazy good.

3.5 stars for the ambiance because I like shared tall bench seating

2 stars for painfully slow and confused service on a Friday

and the unfortunate

1 star for losing a patron's credit card & advertising the loss by spastically looking for it while disrupting others' would-be chill lunch time with 'oh sh*ts' and 'god fu*cking dam sh*t f*cken A'    really?  Tourette syndome is pretty common around this neighborhood from the homeless and drug abusing populace but from staff?   Not cool.

updated and honestly have to average you guys out to a 3.

Solicited (or unsolicited?) advice:
Please hire more (calm) staff for Fridays if you're going to open for lunch.
author: Athena S.

description: Fun Steelers bar with Pittsburgh style sandwiches (thick bread slices, lots of meat, cheese, with fries and coleslaw inside too!).  I am gluten intolerant, and sensitive to dairy too, but their chicken wings are gluten free (bbq was awesome).  They have a good wine selection too, especially for a bar that has many beers on tap.  Waitress Alex is kind and attentive!
author: Emma L.

description: This place is pretty great. First, I like the atmosphere, it's very chill, relaxed and fun. If you're not into the bro sports bar scene, then this place is probably not for you. I do have to say, their sandwiches are DEEElicious. I usually get the turkey with bacon on it and beer. There happy hour is until 7. Also, you can choose from 3 spaces: outside, bar or restaurant sides. Overall, great food, good selection on tap (lots of local beers) and relaxed atmosphere.
author: Tom T.

description:
There was  plenty of seating available friday night for some beers and sandwiches. Sandwiches come with fries inside, nice. Onion rings were pretty good too.

This would be a great place to see a game.
author: Ameer N.

description: Very big sports bar. A lot of tvs, pool tables, sitting areas. Huge selection of beers and food. Just a lot going on. Perfect for going to with a bunch of friends, but not really my scene. Fun to hang out at for a while though.
author: Dexter H.

description: Absolutely love this place. Wings, sambo with fries in it, True to its Pittsburgh roots. Cool beers selection. Staff always friendly. Great atmosphere
author: Andrew S.

description:
The best place to watch a Steelers game in SF.  
Fans of Primanti Bros. would be proud.
Sandwiches are solid.
Service is quick even during high intensity games.
Pittsburgh clientele and memorabilia make it a must for those from the Steel City in SF.
author: Doc R.

description:
It's real simple. 

Order any sandwich and ADD THE EGG. 

Bliss.
author: Nikke G.

description:
I usually don't write reviews so rigidly tied to actual star allocation (nor do I particularly like them) but it seems to be mandatory for this place.

Let's break it down like this:
NHL Network = 1 star
This is a dubious award given that I'd rather get my hockey fix at Kilowatt and I've even noticed my pals over at Lucky 13 seem to have it as well though at Lucky I'm hesitant to ask for it to be put on.

Beer selection = .5 star
It's slight above average however everything is probably priced about a dollar or two more than what it should be for the Mission (thus the half star).

Sandwiches = 1 star
I haven't actually had them but given that they're available until around 11:30p-ish (according to the bartender) and given that they look awesome, they remain the untapped potential of this place.

All summed up that makes it about 2.5 stars.

I think probably a big part of it is just that, well, this place has no charm.  It's kind of just two big bright painted rooms with a few shuffleboards.  In any other neighborhood this place would probably be gold, but given where and what it is, it definitely isn't enough to pull me away from my favorite Mission haunts.  I can see some thinking this is a nice alternative to the low lit dirty dive bars of the area but to be honest that's kind of why I hang out here.  It seems like if I wanted to have some big bash with tons of space, this might be ideal but even then I might try to pack everyone in at Elixir, Dalva or Thieves.

Also the insanely bad late 90's-early 00's "alternative" rock blasting out loud didn't help either.
author: Steven R.

description:
This place is Bomb! I was so happy to see an awesome sandwich place open up in this area in the Mission, not to mention an all around sweet sports bar which was seriously lacking in the area.

It's a great location with a fun friendly staff, big screens lining the walls with all games on, an incredible beer selection and of course..... great food.

These Philadelphia style sandwiches are stacked, loaded with meat of your choice, cheese, sweet/tangy coleslaw and yes..... French Fries. All piled high in between two slices of soft fresh delicious bread. They also have some great bar snacks to enjoy with your beer during a game like Fried Pickles (Yum!) Hot Wings, Onion Rings, scrumptious little Pierogies and Fries.

This is a great place to come on game day with the crew, get some good filling eats and pound down a few pints from their incredible beer selection and enjoy the good times.
author: Uriah B.

description: Laid back bar in the mission with a lot of beer choices and sand options. Shuffleboard and founded by Pittsburgh-ers.
author: John L.

description:
I love this place.  The beer selection is phenomenal (also, as should be the norm but tragically is not in this area, their beer is always ice cold and the glasses are actually clean), the sandwiches are fantastic and a unique offering for the area, and the wings are absolutely killer.

The Mission location is doing things right!
author: Tony H.

description: Get the hot capicola with a fried egg.  That's all you need to know.  You can't ever go wrong with french fries in your sandwich.  Also, very worth it to share with someone else as the sandwich is pretty big and heavy.
author: Tori Q.

description: Giordano Bros is a great place to grab a Pittsburgh-style sandwich--this is true for both the North Beach and Mission locations. That said, the Mission location is perfect for wasting an entire Sunday on football. It is hands-down my favorite spot to watch the Niners as well as every other game happening in the league not only because of the abundance of TVs, but also because the beer and food are the perfect accompaniment. Try the Capicola.
author: Steven W.

description: I can't say enough about Giordano Bros.  I first fell in love with this place thanks to my friend AMFB!  She introduced me to my boy John (North Beach location) who always keeps my Stellas glass full.  Since I live across town, making the trek was difficult (I know, SF is only 7x7 with a plethora of public transit options)...Until the Mission location opened.  Not as many Die HARD Steelers fans as the original but the feeling remains.  The not so new space is 4x the size of the original, plenty of flat screen tv's to capture all your sporting needs, shuffle board, a HUGE beer and alcohol menu and the world famous Giordano Sando.  If you don't know about it you better stop by.  Because "nobody ain't got no time" to explain.  We're too busy eating.
author: Venney B.

description:
Perogis were edible. Came out a good 10 minutes before my boyfriends sandwich. Super peeve of mine.
Boyfriends capicola sand was good, but I had to sit and watch him eat it since mine was at the table 10 mins before.
Beer selection was good.
Service was terrible. Our waitress thought flirting with techies was what she was supposed to be doing.
Wouldn't recommend unless you're close by and just want a beer.
author: Katie V.

description: This place is a good time with great beer. I hear the sandwiches are fantastic and will definitely be back to investigate that situation!
author: Madison O.

description: They're in San Francisco and carry Yuengling!  They'll justifiably charge you an arm and a leg for it... but they have Yuengling!  If you wanted to know how thorough they are bringing the right menu and ambiance, this is a pretty good indication.
author: Jim S.

description: Great sandwiches, great service and a great setup. This is a great place to eat, a great place to watch a game and a great place to have some fun. I think the Salami all-in-one sandwich is the best, but so good.
author: Scott N.

description:
This place is amazing, I'm so glad there's now this location in the Mission. Finally, a good sports bar in the Mission! Great sandwiches at affordable prices, plus the new location has perogies! 

And the shuffleboard table is great too.
author: Shanan A.

description:
After trying Giordano out this weekend, I already know that I will be spending most of my Sundays here during football season. A great addition to the mission! 

They offer a nice selection of beer (and some wine options) and a good but limited food selection as well. The TV's are big and well positioned throughout the place so everyone can enjoy the game. The sandwiches are definitely worth a try although I still prefer my fries on the side. :) I was also really pleasantly surprised by just how nice and friendly the bar staff was, asking every patron at the bar his/her name and remembering the names the whole time I was there. Pretty impressive! Looking forward to going back soon.
author: Foodie K.

description: This place is like Primanti Bros. in Pittsburgh except the food tastes even better than it looks. To top if off they have a ton of TV's to watch football and more than a dozen drafts. The hot cappicola is the best, I couldnt ask for more.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
If you want to go to a place with slammin sandwhiches but act like they are doing you  a favor by serving you food then this is your spot.  The staff seems knowledgable about the beer and food items, however getting their attention is mighty difficult.
I went there and waiting 5 minutes to be acknowlegded and then given a menu and then another 5 minutes before he took my order for beer I decided I better order my sammy then.  So I did.  The sandwhiches were done in no time however getting out server to go the pick up window and pick them up was another thing.  My friend after waiting 5 minutes for him to even look in out direction asked him to pick up our sandwhiches.  Then at the end when we had to hunt him down yet again to get our check I hand him cash and then he takes someones elses check and proceeds to close them out first.  I have never felt so unwelcomed.  I happen to frequent the mission area at least twice weekly and am frequently giving restuarant recommendation.  This will now be on my "dont waste your time list."  I hope that this does get to the right person and the staff will take their customer service more seriously.
author: Rachel C.

description:
My BFF, visiting the US after 2 years away, reaaaaalllly wanted a turkey sandwich, so we went in here for lunch. The only two vegetarian sandwich options were double egg... and just cheese. Well, darn, that isn't really very exciting at all; and I've come to expect better in this town, which is JAMMED FULL of veggie/vegan/gluten-free people and places. 

When I asked one desperate question too many about veggie options and alternatives ("Can you throw some tomato into a sandwich, at least?"), the server got snarky. He must have thrown some extra jalapenos into my veggie chili at that point, because it was CRAZY HOT, so basically tasted like canned tomato sauce with a shot of mad spice in every bite. And I'm Indian, so I can do spice. Jeez. 

I can see how it might be fun to hang out here at night, play shuffleboard, and watch a game, but make sure you're carnivores only. The veggie experience here is made of fail.
author: Simran T.

description: Excellent service during one of the chaotic World Series games but the food was blah.  Buffalo wings were bland without any spices to them.  The ingredients of the pastrami and the coppa w/ fried egg sandwiches were fresh but the flavors needed a kick to them.  The fries inside the sandwich didn't do much to the bland flavors.
author: L T.

description: Keep yourself busy by playing shuffleboard but keep in mind, greasy hands from onion rings and sand should never go together.
author: Dora C.

description: This place is amazing. Really great beer list and one of the most delicious sandwiches I've ever eaten. We love this place so much, that we hosted our very unconventional rehearsal dinner here. Our 100+ guests had a great time and the owner took incredible care of us. Thank you Giordano Bros!  You continue to be one of our favorite spots.
author: Megan B.

description: Very good food, friendly waiters, super cheap happy hour specials. A very solid Friday afternoon bar.
author: Stephan S.

description:
BEST Sports Bar anywhere NEAR The Mission, hands down!  This Sports Bar/Pittsburgh haven has 24 beers on tap, the BEST sandwich you will ever eat, deep-fried pickles and the best pierogies I've ever had.

If you go on a Sunday, you are sure to see EVERY NFL game, accompanied by an entire STEELERS SIDE for Steelers fans. (GO STEELERS!)

Service always has a smile and prices are super reasonable.  Check this place out. Or you're missing out.
author: Amie B.

description: I really like this place. They have great bloody mare's which are my favorite , I just experienced my first Jameson with a pickle back shot and I loved it , and the food is good. The only thing I could complain about is service. On non game days the staff is really nice and rad. On game days the wait staff can be gruff and slightly non -attentive. I get it on one hand I don't think I could handle a ton of loud sports fans needing refills and all that etc , but I still feel like this is your job and you know where you are working. We all have bad days or get annoyed(I AM NO SAINT) ... but if I'm paying you a tip and all that can you maybe smile for me? Just once? Just a thought
author: Lauren V.

description: My favorite bar in Mission. Obsessed with the Pickleback shot and making all my friends try it. The patrons themselves are very friendly which I love.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Mmmm butter.  Man they use a lot of butter on their wings.  Really good wings with a tasty sauce.  Did I mention that they use butter.  Traditional Buffalo wing sauce is butter and hot sauce, but I'm not sure it calls for this much butter.  But hey, they have good wings that are cooked well.  Tasty!
author: Mr Buffalo Wings S.

description: Just spent several days in San Francisco. Really enjoyed watching the World Series games at this great sports bar. Wonderful beer and cocktail choices. The best sandwiches, fried pickles and pierogis ever!  All the staff and the owner are super nice. Service is attentive even when they're at capacity, which was the case every day. Will definitely go back on my next trip.
author: Pamela D.

description: FRIES IN YOUR SANDWICH (Pittsburgh, you're genius)...beers and Irish Car Bombs on St. Patty's.. good place to be
author: Jennifer A.

description: Had the pastrami sandwich with a side of onion rings..very delicious..was weary of eating cole slaw in my sandwich  but it worked perfectly wi the meat and fries...also service was very friendly..will definitely go again to try out other sandwiches
author: Ghezal O.

description:
Very Very good sports atmosphere.  Patrons were loud and responsive to the games events as they occurred. I like places that allow for cheering and booing. (places that have sports on and don't allow for patrons to be loud should perhaps not serve alcohol)  Ample seating, The items on the menu were perfect for watching the games and eating.  

Had Buffalo wings and 2 of the "Pittsburgh all in 1 sandwiches", 1 was turkey and 1 was pastrami.  Both came with melted cheese and a nice non creamy slaw and FRIES, all on very soft yet crusty Italian home-style bread. (Very good sandwiches, the slaw and fries together are a nice pairing)  The wings were tangy and with just enough kick. Had a bottle of ginger beer that was a good refreshing washdown.

 All of it was reasonably priced and prepared rather quickly.  

Do go if you want hands on food, loud and interactive sports viewing, 
Don't go if you want to use silver ware and seeking a quiet quaint PBS atmosphere. 

Not 5 stars because I am a Raiders fan and this wonderful place is I think owned by steelers fans.
author: F And J Consolidate D.

description:
service is friendly & food is solid, but i like the cozy space of the north beach location better - that one has more of a neighborhood vibe whereas this one feels a bit more sterile and commercial.   also, the bread on my sandwich was not as soft, as if it had been left out in the air for a bit too long.

still good tho!  and shuffleboard is pretty neat!
author: Josie M.

description:
* I didn't eat here because I was so turned off by the shitty vibe I got when I walked thru the door*

So I walk in with my aunt and cousin and we've never been here so we ask the (rude ass) waitress what the deal is. Do we seat ourselves? How does this work? She rolls her eyes and waves her hand around and says "You get what you get". Okay...there are no seats and when we did spot an empty (except for the remnants of a 75% eaten sandwich) table and tried to sit down, some bearded loser comes out of nowhere and says he's sitting there. Nice. A table for three people is being occupied by you alone because you want to take bites between your game of shuffleboard...dick. 


Also this place was full of hipster assholes.
author: sara r.

description: I have always been a fan of the North Beach location since they were the first to open and it is so close to my house, but with hanging out in the mission so much lately I find myself here alot now. They took the North Beach shop to the next level. This place has the great food - (read Sando, wings and pierogies), with outside space, shuffleboard, lots of TVs for any sports action you could want and they just got a full bar. Plus they always have good unusual beers on tap.  And the waitstaff are super friendly and helpful.
author: Sean Q.

description:
3.5
Great bar food! Definitely not fine dining but terrific if you want some bad for you food.
Went here with 3 friends.  We just wanted beer and salty snacks. I like the space  --- it's welcoming. Service was very personable - patient - attentive --- we liked our guy. 
We split the egg sandwich, some pieroghis, fries, and a side of wing sauce. 
The other kids also spilt the coppa and sausage sandwiches. The thought the sausage sandwich was the bomb. 
I liked the egg sandwich - you could taste the contract in ingredients/texture - eggs/fries/slaw-  slaw probably could've used a little more salt. And the bread is perfect for a hearty sandwich -  I rarely eat sandwiches/bread and this was worth the calories. 
I don't eat chicken wings but I love the sauce.  Their sauce is the bomb - made with Frank's Hot Sauce. Much better than ketchup with fries! 
The pieroghis were pretty good. Decent filling to dough ratio.  Could've been a tad crispier. 
And the beer is great - they go beyond IPA's and the usual boring California beers. Good variety- something for every taste. 
I'll be back when that salty snack/beer craving resurfaces....
author: Carson R.

description:
My boyfriend and I sat outside here on a very sunny Sunday afternoon. It was beautiful!! 
Our server, Anna, was wonderful! She brought out a doggie bowl filled with ice water for my pup without me even having to ask! It was very sweet. A place who takes care of my dog definitely gets 5 stars!!
The sandwiches come with fries on them..I recommend adding the egg. The fries are super delicious so order a side even though there are some on the sandwich already.
author: Christi B.

description: The inside smelled like B.O., but it looked nice and had football on TV which is boss. We opted to sit outside in the sun. This sounded like a great call until this old weird lady on one of those walking rockers was just taking her sweet time creeping by. The only problem with that is I'm trying to eat my buffalo wings (which were A LOT better than expected. Highly recommended.) and you smell like a huge dump. I mean, how am I supposed to eat when you're two feet away from me smelling like a dump and staring at me for 5 minutes (like you've had way too much acid 30 years ago).  The wings were bomb though. Give them a shot.
author: Michael L.

description: I have been wanting to come here for a while now and last night, I finally made it happen.  The idea of french fries in a sandwich has intrigued me since I got a doner sandwich somewhere in Greece.  Let's do it American style now.  Sadly, the Giordano sandwich had everything rocking besides the meat.  The fries, coleslaw, vinegar and pillow soft bread all worked well together, but the roast beef was ever so limp.  Perhaps I should have gone with the Coppa or Turkey.  The onion rings, like the sandwich, was piled mile high.  Though far too low on onion and a little too high on batter.  So why four stars?  Well, I like the vibe of the place.  It's casual and comfortable and reminds me of a nice sports bar in the burbs.  Also, it may be the cheapest meal you can find this close to Valencia.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Awesome sandwiches- vinegar based coleslaw and fried w your choice of meat on fresh Italian bread. Try it!
author: Valerie F.

description: A perfect addition to the mission!  The men I was with took down 20 wings each and had nothing but great things to say (when they had time to breathe and talk). I got the "just cheese" Pittsburgh style sandwich and it was amazing.  The beer selection was extensive and the service was crazy good.  Definitely recommend Gioradano Bros if you want to watch sports or even if you just want some great grub!
author: Amy N.

description: Great sandwich place if you are in the area.  Sandwiches are delicious and fairly priced, most between $6.50 - $7.50.  The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because sometimes it gets busy and it seems they run short on wait staff.
author: Jon P.

description: I love this place ! The staff is super friendly and knowledgable. Gets packed but not too bad. Best buffalo wings and LOVE the kielbasa sausage sandwich...def a fav! Not too mention the beers available and all the t.v.s surrounding you (keep in mind might not be the place for a quiet romantic dinner). Fun place to go with friends though!
author: Anita B.

description:
the food is really good. its your basic bar food but executed very well and for a good price. the sandwiches are better than the original primanti bros in pittsburgh. i recommend the pastrami and add a fried egg. the staff is really friendly and i think genuinely hospitable, that goes a really long way with me. they are very welcoming and really put the effort towards making you feel comfortable and welcome. 

if youre a sports fan this is a great place to hang out and watch games. if youre a Pittsburgh sports fan, this is the absolute perfect place to hang out and watch games. steelers and penguins games are always on. definitely a home away from home. they have a lot of nice tvs all throughout the entire place so theres always a good view.

all this combined makes this one of my favorite places in the bay area.

Steeler Nation is alive and well in the bay area.
author: Mike Y.

description: I've been here a few times now and I really enjoy it! I got the coopa sandwich, it's like a hot prociutto, so good! Sandwiches comes with fries and cole slaw inside, just a few fries and not at all soggy slaw. Eat it whole, it's better than you'd think. I was sick and asked for a hot drink like a hot toddy, they didn't have something regular, but Yvonne the bartender made me something special, she's so sweet. Her and the other bartender Whitney and her sing "Squirrels, squirrels squirrels" whenever "girls, girls, girls" comes on the juke box. Nice, casual, not dive bar. Usually have local sports game on. Shuffleboard.
author: Cristina W.

description: I had been to Giordano Brothers in North Beach, so I was excited when they opened a location in the Mission.  Unfortunately, the food was not very good.  The space itself is much nicer and larger than the North Beach location.  The sandwich we ordered had a pretty dull flavor and the chili tasted like minestrone soup (Olive Garden style).  I will not be back.
author: Sarah K.

description: 4 stars for the All-In-One sandwiches alone. What really sets this place above the rest though is that they have created a quality sports bar in the Mission. They have a top-notch beer selection, and have improved upon the NB shop with a more spacious location and the addition of some excellent pierogies.
author: Adam S.

description: Although parking isn't that easy in the Mission, I actually prefer this location of Giodano Bros over the original one in North Beach. This location is twice as big, has more TVs, a much larger beer selection, pool and shuffleboard. The menu is the same as the original one, but also has pierogies as well. They are on the small side but a nice variation. The sandwiches are just as great - my favorite is Coppa with egg and fries extra crispy.  This is a great spot to catch a game and relax with friends.
author: Rachelle T.

description: Cool place, great food with simple menu. Awesome low key place to hang out.
author: Emily Y.

description: I wouldn't call it "Pittsburgh style", but they put fries and such on the sandwiches. That's the only connection to Primati brothers I could find. Tastes completely different. I actually completely agree with Elizabeth--my sandwich was gummy and bland. I think it needs a bit more work. My husband loved his! I've just had a lot better.
author: Cristin L.

description: I love this place. Never had a sandwich like this. The bread is great. Super fresh french loaf. Thick but when you bite into it its super soft. Every sandwich has french fries and coleslaw in it. Never had that before but hell bomb combo. I get my sandwich with a fried egg which really putts it over the top. The buffalo wings are bomb. Super traditional sauce but really delicious. The fried pickles are bomb. Very crunch and fresh. I thing they make their own pickles which really makes them different. I would give them 5 stars but Ike's is, in my opinion the BEST, so I can't do it. Still love this place though. And the waitresses are pretty fine as well.
author: Breezy E.

description: When I heard that Giordano Bros. was opening in the mission, the little fat kid inside of me just couldn't wait to try it.  Hence why I showed up minutes after 5pm on opening day!  The outside of the building is now painted black, an update from the former blue Ti Couz.  The inside has been updated with new yellow and brick red paint, natural woods, a bar, and several TVs showing whatever local sporting event is on at the time.  I felt so butch inside watching sports, drinking a beer, and having a Hot Capicola sandwich stuffed full with fries and cole slaw!  Once done, I attempted to waddle home completely stuffed full of spicy goodness.  The food is great and features the same menu as their North Beach site.  The service was decent and our waitress was both friendly and knowledgable.  My only complaint was the noise level inside.  The volume was turned all the way up for the game and the empty walls amplified the voices to an almost deafening level.  Other than that, this place is well on its way to becoming a new Mission hot spot.
author: Sean H.

description: I spent almost an entire afternoon here with a friend, and our server did not mind at all.  We got some sandwiches, onions rings, chicken wings and several beers.  Our waters were regularly refilled, and the servers were great with recommending different beers to try.  They don't have a full bar but I was satisfied.  It's easier to get to than the other location, so I may be at this spot more often.
author: Seong P.

description: Fantastic sandwiches...I got the hot capicola. Great draft beer selection, friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere.
author: Scott B.

description: What's not to love about Giordano's?  A fantastic spot with awesome sandwiches, a welcome beer selection, and ambiance to boast about.  I point this place out to others whenever I can.
author: Ken B.

description: Big ass sando!!! Best meat combo I've had there is the coppa and steak with a fried egg. Great slaw!! Vinegar and oil with black pepper not slaw with mayo crap! Just the way I love it! Great Pittsburgh sando spot!! Definitely recommend. The place is also a big bar with a bunch of flat screen tvs playing all sorts of sports.
author: Ethan S.

description: This is what a neighborhood hang out bar should be like. I came here at night, around 9pm on a Saturday night. It's super convenient, right off Bart so you don't have to drive anywhere.... The food smelled really good and I wish I ate here instead of the crappy Thai food I had earlier. There were comfy chairs and couches spread out, a pool table, obviously bar stools and tables. My boyfriend and I played 2 rounds of pool with some random patrons.. had a few drinks. The ambiance is very laid back, very bicycle messenger-ish.
author: Penelope V.

description: Umm can we say YUMMY!? My friend had been raving about this sandwich for the longest time so we decided to come here for our pre-thanksgiving meal. I ordered the {HOT CAPICOLA w FRIED EGG} loved the sandwich and the textures with the fries and egg. I'm a fan of adding hot sauce on this bad boy - pretty lip smacking delicious.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is Great for watching the game, having a beer, or just sitting with a satisfying sandwich. Me and my girlfriend were really sad to see Ti Couz  leave this location, but Giordano Bros filled the shoes nicely. The sandwiches are Pittsburgh style. they're full of italian meats and french fries and dont forget to ask for their hot sauce basket, they have nearly 10 different varieties of hot sauces to slam into your sandwich. THe lighting in the space is good, lots of screens and seats and its right in the heart of the Mission, near Bart. Great meet up spot.
author: Adam G.

description: While not even close to replacing my beloved Ti Couz, a sammy and a beer here is an above-average meal. The hot sausage and a mug of Oktoberfest brew did it for me.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I prefer my fries on the side. Unless they taste absolutely great, that I'd want to want to eat them and my sandwich both at the same time! That is, assuming the sandwich is also great to begin with. Neither is the case.
author: Alexia R.

description: Good selection of beers and food items are ok.  If you want to watch a game on Sunday, maybe you need to get here at least 2 hours early?  So unbelievably crowded this past Sunday.. Had to give up and go elsewhere.
author: David H.

description: Not bad.  Pittsburgh style sammies were okay (they put fries ON the sandwich), but a tad bland.  Decent beer selection with mostly microbrews, though the Bud Light is on tap for the doosh contingent that shows up to watch sportsgames on the bigscreen.  Turn down the volume, will ya?  For a Mission space, it's pretty solid and not too trendy.  Laid back and unpretentious.  Sort of a blue collar jock vibe.  I say it's okay if you just want a sammy and a beer without hassle.  But not a lot of character or verve here.
author: Paul S.

description: This place is awesome. Flat screen tvs all over the place, awesome food, friendly staff, various beer selection. Biggest difference between this place and their spot in North Beach is the spaciousness. But both places are still awesome. Great establishment that hopefully will be around for a very long time.
author: Alvin T.

description: I tried the Coppa as many people recommended.  It was definitely tasty, but on the salty side.  Make sure you drink beer with it.
author: MT Y.

description: This was an ok place. Nothing to crazy exciting. Was a quick place for a beer BUT the people inside are crazy friendly and if we lived here, we would make a ton of friends at this bar.
author: Casandra R.

description: Fun bartender who really took care of me. Sandwiches are fun and tasty and the wings are great. Good place to watch football.
author: Stacy W.

description: Having never eaten at the North Beach one I wondered how the Mission one would pan out...  I was pleasantly surprised when I came with a few buddies for lunch.  Coppa sandwich was delectible and the abundance of Hoegaarden to wash it down with was an extremely delicious complement.  Really happy with this establishment.  Nice exterior also, on a sunny day a sandwich and suds outdoors next to Valencia can't be beat.
author: Sin F.

description: LOVE the people who work here - always friendly people and fast service.  Sports bars are not usually my thing, however, it is one of the few sports bars that I actually like hanging out in.  I like the layout, the staff, weekend mimosas and of course the fried pickles!!!  I've seen lots of people complain that it isn't a replacement for Ti Couz - I loved that place - however comparing this to Ti Couz is an unfair comparison.  They are completely different businesses.  Businesses come and go - it's not like this business space was reserved for crepe places only.  This place is worth checking out.
author: Allison M.

description: Nice change of pace for the 16th street hipster scene. Normal Sports bar, fun great atmosphere.  I still wish the food would be a bit better... but it was all 'pittsburgh' style food.. which I still think they could offer stuff that might be a tad bit healthier... maybe they don't want to sell out!? I am from buffalo, so I understand.
author: Best M.

description: I was impressed just walking into the second location for this great place. Huge bar, and plenty of seating and games makes it not only a place to amble out of with a full stomach in tow but also a place to have some beers with friends. As I believe that second locations usually can't recapture the flavors of the first, I was a little worried going in that the food wouldn't be as good, but one bit set those fears to rest. A great sandwich, and certainly one of a kind in the city.
author: Marc M.

description: Cappa sandwich was pretty decent.  Very simple a plain.   The slaw and fries don't add too much flavor to the sandwich, but the  texture is nice.  I actually got a fair amount of meat, 12 layers of cappa (I was a little worried from reading other reviews.  Not bad for $7.25.
author: Jerry W.

description:
I'd heard good things about Giorano's so I was happy to stumble on the place and see it open.  It had a good atmosphere and the staff was friendly enough, a few of the staff even came back to make sure that my order had been taken.

There was a party of 10 that came in ahead of me so I understand the wait for my food, but I was less than impressed.  In the steak sandwich, the meat quality was ok, I would have preferred to have more of a sear on the outside, bringing out more of the natural meat flavor.  The fries were soggy and lukewarm at best, but the biggest disappointment was the slaw.  While it did provide a nice crunch and texture to the sandwich, it was boring, no tang or bite that I've come to expect from a good slaw.  I'd be willing to try it again but I'll wait a little longer, let them settle in a bit more.

Food gets 2 stars but the staff was nice, so that gets 1 more.
author: Mike I.

description: I am still morning the loss of Ti Couz but was happy to give Giordano Brothers a try when a friend suggested it as a pre-show drinking spot.  When it was a restaurant, this space always felt really cramped to me, but as a bar, it feels spacious in comparison to other Mission bars.  Plenty of seating, and the volume of noise in the bar wasn't overwhelming (I suppose it could be different during a game day).  The draft beer selection is good, with some beers changing seasonally, and the happy hour prices are reasonable. I've not tried their food yet but have heard good things about the sides. My only complaint was that bar service was a little slow.  On a Friday night, they only had one person working behind the bar.  The bar wasn't very crowded at all, and our first drinks were served up quickly, but after that it took a long time to get the bartender's attention to get a drink or place a food order.
author: Heidi M.

description:
The sandwiches are still as good as they are in North Beach.

Updated:
Jeff J. (Owner) responded immediately to my fax and emailed me back later that day. He asked a battery of questions that helped him narrow down the cause of my soapy beer glassware experience. He very logically came to a conclusion, and promised to take the necessary steps to address the issue. I commend Jeff for his accountability and responsibility for the new Mission location. It made me feel good inside that there still are proprietors that take customer feedback seriously. Further updates may be in order when I end up back at the Mission Giordano Bros (still a loyal North Beach customer, had a great time there Christmas Eve day for lunch and football).
author: Chris C.

description:
Soooo sad! A real slap in the face for anyone from Pittsburgh. This is the third time in a row this place has crapped on me so I thought I'd final write a review and call it quits on Giordano Bros. I wanted to believe! 

Where do I start? Lets begin with service. The bar, rather small for Mission standards, maybe 10-15 seats. One bartender who was in the weeds from the beginning of me sitting down at half time for Monday night football (7:30ish pm). The Steeler's weren't playing and the place was truly dead. I managed to catch a drink during the "rush" 10 minutes in. 

Proceeded to order a standard sandwich off the menu with my beverage (the Coppa @ $7.50). Being from Pittsburgh I was momentarily excited to get a taste of home. I gave a double star to this review because of the price, cheap sandwich. Unfortunately the fresh Coppa with it's crispy fries and juice slaw came to the window and there she sat. I truly believed it wasn't my sandwich because it came up pretty quick. But there it sat as I watched it die throughout the 3rd quarter (about 40minutes). The sammy that I hoped and prayed wasn't mine was presented to me as cold as I thought, about the time I was finally asked if I'd like another beer.  

What a waste of a good setup. Great location, great menu (Pittsburgh style) and the original in North Beach isn't bad. But the service utterly sucks, the sandwiches are half the size you'd get in Pittsburgh, and the meat and fries taste old and stale. Overall a complete let down for what I'd hope would be my favorite new local. Stay in North Beach Giordano Bros we don't want you in the Mission!
author: Average C.

description:
My new favorite spot to watch Giants games! Not only are the sandwiches amazing (I recommend the Hot Cappicola), but the buffalo wings may be the best in the city.. It doesn't hurt that they have a great beer selection and a shuffleboard table that I will be logging many hours on. 

The service is super friendly and casual-Definitely my new neighborhood bar.
author: Alex S.

description: very good pastrami with fries just wish the bread was warmer an the slaw was mayo based instead , they have a great beer selection  , very good vibe and friendly service...
author: NAEL K.

description: i really wanted to love this sandwich but it wasn't anything i feel inclined to ever come back to. the one component of the sandwich that is supposed to set itself apart from others is the addition of fries but i couldn't even tell they were in there really. they didn't have any distinct flavor or add any crunch.
author: Regina C.

description: Holy crap - could they put LESS meat on their sandwiches?  I doubt it.  Maybe they could use a razor blade to slice it thinner and increase their profit margins even more?  I'm sure they will when they think of it.  Jeez!!!
author: Jon B.

description:
pittsburgh style sandwiches are a thing. they aren't really my thing though. i've been to primanti brothers (in pittsburgh - the place this place models it's menu after sorta) and i wasn't any more impressed or disgusted by giordano brothers sandwiches. both places though - i don't understand why if you're putting french fries in a sandwich you can't make them thin and hot and crispy. mushy fries in bread with cole slaw doesn't stand a chance of being tasted. it's just a calorie booster.

the things i enjoy about this place are the pierogies, the tvs, and the fact that there is a shuffleboard. not that i've played it because it's always crowded, but it's good to know it's there.

but no iron city beer. and that yuengling sign but no yuengling to drink? that's just cruel.
author: Will R.

description: Best Bar in San Francisco!  That cute sassy blonde waitress is reason enough to go...but the chili is yummy, and there are really yummy onion rings, too!
author: Jane v.

description: Recently stopped into Giordano Bros before a concert at the Brick and Mortar on Sunday night.  Came in with two other friends to share a beer and hang out.  The bartender on shift was an young blond woman who had no more than 6 people sitting at the bar, yet almost immediately made me wait for several minutes while she chatted up a patron.  After I asked politely whether kitchen was still open at 8:30pm, I placed an order for wings.  She paused and said "Uh, I guess"  when I asked if I could have a half-and-half sauce on my order.  Strike!  About an hour later, there were still no wings, so my friend went up to ask about them---since the bartender had already forgotten to give him the beer he ordered half an hour before.  He said the bartender would be able to comp some of the cost, and she even came over to apologize.  Said she'd be able to take half the cost off the wings, which was more than sufficient.  At this point, I didn't care about the cost, I was just wondering what the hold-up was.  I felt pretty bad for badmouthing her beforehand, and gave a sincere "thank you"....but when I went to close out the tab, she let me know that I had to pay full price AFTER she swiped my card and gave me the receipt to sign.  Walked out of there flabbergasted, and am never going there again.
author: Andres G.

description: Great friendly service. "subway" prices ($6) for a huge sandwhich. I had steak, and they put cole slaw, oil and vinegar and crispy frenchfries on each sandwhich, and the bread is thick, fluffy, and sweet. Was not expecting such a good sandwhich at this price point and I had a seat on a wall booth with a pillow to watch a football game while eating. Staff was very generous and checked on us periodically to make sure everything was to our liking. Definiely recommend this spot to anybody, the looks of the place are welcoming like cheers but may imply the food isnt great but it really is amazing! great food, great help, great price, right by all the tourist action in dt San Fran!
author: Joey G.

description: Good beer selection and great sandwiches. The bar is loud during Steelers games, but pretty chill and not douchey at other times.  This place is my new weekly hangout. Convenient location that beats going up to North Beach.
author: Rich L.

description: The absolute best shuffleboard table in town.  Excellent Sandwiches, Great beer selection, and great service.
author: James O.

description:
The sandwiches are good portioned..not too big and not too small. We shared a hot sausage sandwich, a hot capicola sandwich with fried egg, large beer battered onion rings with ranch dressing as a dip and a large order (6 pieces) of potato perogie with a side of sour cream dip.  

The sandwiches are a great mix of crunchiness with the fries and the sourness of the slaw..great combo and different from your traditional sandwich. The beer battered onion rings were done perfectly with the perfect crunch while the perogies were a bit interesting as it was my first time trying it..it's a bit bland & doughy for my taste.

Casual sports bar atmosphere with bar stool tables and big screen TVs surroundings.
Street parking is not great but plentiful if it's not on the weekends.

I gave this a 3 stars because of two incidents on service. The place wasn't busy, they had 4 tables and the waitress came by to check in on us soon after our food was brought out but didn't offer refills on our fountain drinks so we figured there's no free refills..one would think that all 4 drinks are tapped out with a table full of food that one would be thirsty? So I decided to ask and the waitress took 3 of our glasses to refill..the only problem was, not all of their glasses are the same..some glasses have 'Steelers' printed on them and some without..when the glasses were returned to us filled with our original straws and at after much sipping, I realized that my glass initially didn't have the word 'Steelers' on it and noticed that the glasses were swapped with my friends glass. First reaction was ew but it's ok since we're all friends but still, ew. Can you imagine if your glass was swapped with a stranger? 

For those of you who may think, well, maybe she replaced our glass with new ones..negative. If that was the case, we'd probably get new straws. Again, stressing the ew factor.  It makes me appreciate restaurants that refills your glass by either coming to your table with a pitcher or giving you a new glass/straw altogether.
author: Sophia M.

description: Great ambiance and nice, laid back servers.  Their sandwiches are TO DIE FOR! Sooo good, I get a side of buffalo sauce (always, whenever, wherever) and choice of any meat.  Good place to grab a beer and watch the game also.
author: Emily M.

description: I LOVE IT HERE. ive been missing a sports bar so bad and had a huge craving for delicious food that makes u regret it the next hour and this place is perfect. their sandwiches are like all sandwiches should be, with coleslaw (which makes it vinegary YUM) and fries! the wings were not skimping on sauce. i went here when it wasnt a game day so the food was fast and the pitchers were kept filled so i am not sure what it would be like otherwise but please go here. its amazing. id be there everyday if i wasnt trying to keep my figure.
author: Lola r.

description: I met a friend there just to share a sandwich and ended up sharing two sandwiches accompanied by two beers! The sandwiches were great and so was the huge selection of beer. I will definitely go back again. Plus our server Tim was an added bonus!
author: Martin F.
